{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"10 online social psychology courses and books that will help you understand people better","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/online-social-psychology-classes-books","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, we may earn money from our affiliate partners. <a href=\"https://www.insider-inc.com/commerce-on-insider-inc/\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9b150a69331a0011bc6259?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Online social psychology courses and books 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">iStock; Gilbert Espinoza/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Social psychology is the study of how people interact with each other, and knowing more about it can improve our relationships and overall happiness.</li><li>These online courses and books help you understand people's differences, mend interpersonal conflicts, and lead with empathy — which are especially important skills to have in a pandemic that makes it harder to connect with others.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/online-courses-that-teach-you-to-be-happier\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Read more: 10 online courses that teach you how to be happier — most are free and taught by Ivy League universities</a></li><li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals</a>.</li></ul><p>Social psychology&#160;— the study of how people's thoughts, beliefs, and actions are impacted by the presence of others — can teach us how to be more connected to our friends, families, partners, coworkers, and communities.&#160;</p><p>Especially in a pandemic, the ability to better understand ourselves and other people brings us closer, even if we're limited to virtual communication or socially distant guidelines.&#160;</p><p>The term \"social psychology\" is used fairly broadly here, encompassing classes that positively impact your personal wellbeing, work relationships, and conflict-management skills. The common thread running through all of them is an emphasis on self-improvement and the idea that our initial perceptions of other people are not always accurate.&#160;</p><p>Some of these classes are free to audit, and the cost of a certificate of completion ranges from $49-$537.30, depending on the learning platform and course.&#160;</p><h2>10 online social psychology classes to help you understand people better:</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe Science of Well-Being\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4f6e69331a0011bc6644?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Science of Well Being 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Coursera</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fthe-science-of-well-being\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on Coursera, free to audit, $49 for certification</a></h3><p>\"The Science of Well-Being\" is Yale's most popular online class for a reason. While much of the course is focused on debunking myths and misconceptions about what will make us happy, there's also a strong emphasis on kindness, gratitude, and social connection. Understanding the small yet significant changes you can make to be more content not only helps you &#8212; it improves your closest relationships, which (spoiler!) also boosts your mood. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/coursera-yale-science-of-wellbeing-free-course-review-overview\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">You can read a review of this course here.</a></p>\n\tIntroduction to Social Psychology\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4f8c69331a0011bc6646?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Introduction to Social Psychology 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">edX</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fcourse%2Fintroduction-to-social-psychology\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on edX, free to audit, $99 for certification</a></h3><p>This thorough introductory course from the University of Queensland in Australia covers all the basics of social psychology, from how we think about ourselves, influence other people, and change our behaviors in social settings. It also explores how prejudices are developed and why our intuitions about others are often incorrect. If you like this course, the school also offers other intro psych courses, like psychological research methods and developmental psychology, which are also included in an <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fxseries%2Fintroduction-developmental-social\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">XSeries bundle</a> you can take for certification or audit for free.&#160;</p>\n\tPsychological First Aid\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fa06f5b310011724821?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Psychological First Aid 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Coursera</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fpsychological-first-aid\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on Coursera, free to audit, $49 for certification</a></h3><p>The term \"first aid\" often refers to physical symptoms, but addressing psychological crises is just as important. This Johns Hopkins course teaches you the RAPID model (Reflective listening, Assessment of needs, Prioritization, Intervention, and Disposition) and how to provide emergency mental health support. It's a great course to take if you work in public health or disaster relief, but can also just teach you a lot about how to support your community or loved ones, especially during a global pandemic that's affecting everyone's emotional wellbeing.&#160;</p>\n\tThe Science of Happiness at Work\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fb369331a0011bc6649?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Science of Happiness at Work 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">edX</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.edx.org%2Fprofessional-certificate%2Fberkeleyx-science-of-happiness-at-work\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on edX, $537.30 for the course</a></h3><p>In this three-part course taught by directors at UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, you'll learn everything you need to know about maintaining healthy workplace relationships. The program covers the core foundations of a happy workplace, tips and tricks for staying resilient during stressful times (like right now), and how to lead with emotional intelligence and empathy. You'll need to pay to take the full program and receive certification, however, you can also audit the individual classes for free.</p>\n\tThe Science of People\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fcf6f5b310011724824?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Science of People 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">CreativeLive</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=59453&#38;urllink=www.creativelive.com%2Fbundle%2Fvanessa-van-edwards-bundle\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on CreativeLive, $249 for 4-class bundle (classes also available individually)</a></h3><p>Taught by behavioral investigator and body language expert Vanessa Van Edwards, this four-class bundle teaches you how to enhance your people skills, body language, negotiation tactics and overall happiness. According to Van Edwards, <a href=\"https://shareasale.com/r.cfm?b=999&#38;u=1088116&#38;m=59453&#38;urllink=www.creativelive.com%2Fclass%2Fthe-power-of-happiness-vanessa-van-edwards\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">40% of happiness is determined by our behavior</a>, which is why her courses focus so much on human interaction. These tiny tweaks can make huge differences in your personal happiness, relationships, and career.</p>\n\tSocial Norms, Social Change I\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fe06f5b310011724825?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Social Norms, Social Change I 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Coursera</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fnorms%23about\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on Coursera, free to audit, $49 for certification</a></h3><p>A collaborative effort between the University of Pennsylvania and UNICEF, this course focuses specifically on social norms, \"the rules that glue societies together.\" You'll learn how to tell the difference between social norms and customs, and how these distinctions can help create policy interventions to create new norms or get rid of outdated, harmful ones. Whether you're interested in advocacy work or just find the subject super interesting, this class will give you a deeper understanding of what really makes a social norm &#8212; and how to use this knowledge to improve your own community or personal life.</p>\n\tThe Arts and Science of Relationships: Understanding Human Needs\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c4ff069331a0011bc664a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The Arts and Science of Relationships 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Coursera</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=40328&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.coursera.org%2Flearn%2Fhuman-needs%23about\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on Coursera, free to audit, $49 for certification</a></h3><p>This University of Toronto course provides an in-depth exploration of relationship management, focusing on the basic principles of The Strategies and Skills Learning and Development System (SSLD). It uses case studies as examples to equip you with the knowledge to assess and deal with relationship management problems &#8212; a particularly valuable skill if you work in healthcare or social work, but also immensely helpful in more intimate relationships as well.&#160;</p>\n\tQuiet: The Power of Introverts in a World That Can't Stop Talking\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c50046f5b310011724827?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Quiet  The Power of Introverts in a World That Can’t Stop Talking 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1668\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00714PZMQ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_102820_online-social-psychology-classes-and-books-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00714PZMQ&#38;linkId=d21ba43b501af2a82563c95adc0e15d4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on Audible, free with 30-day trial, $14.95 per month after trial ends</a></h3><p>If you feel internally conflicted because you secretly love working from home and dread going back to a chatty office, this book is for you. Former attorney (and fellow introvert) Susan Cain talks about the American cultural ideal of the extrovert, and how introverts can feel enormous pressure to be outspoken, participate in brainstorms, and network when they instinctively want to do the exact opposite. It also teaches you how to harness the huge benefits of introversion and collaborate with more extroverted people, so when you finally do return to that open-plan office, you won't feel like your quietness holds you back.</p>\n\t\"Surrounded By Idiots\" by Thomas Erikson\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c501369331a0011bc664d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"“Surrounded By Idiots” by Thomas Erikson 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07VCV4QMH/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_102820_online-social-psychology-classes-and-books-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07VCV4QMH&#38;linkId=0d276f8cdaf1413c0ee9d6bd856ea06d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Available on Audible, free with 30-day trial, $14.95 per month after trial ends</a></h3><p>This Swedish bestseller has sold over one million copies worldwide because it offers a simple (yet detailed) explanation of human behavior and interaction. People are broken down into four types &#8212; Red, Yellow, Green, Blue &#8212; and the book teaches you how to quickly navigate conflict with each personality, from domineering Reds to laid-back Greens. It shows you how to best communicate and give feedback to each type of person, so petty misunderstandings and confusing conflicts can be a thing of the past.&#160;</p>\n\t\"Dare to Lead\" by Brené Brown\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c502069331a0011bc664e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"“Dare to Lead” by Brené Brown 4x3\" height=\"1250\" width=\"1667\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07DJYFLX8/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_102820_online-social-psychology-classes-and-books-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07DJYFLX8&#38;linkId=998831a024a0bb7ffaf4d7c95f4d1a21\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Available on Audible, free with 30-day trial, $14.95 per month after trial ends</a></h3><p>Researcher, \"Daring Greatly\" author, and viral TED Talk speaker Bren&#233; Brown wrote this book to specifically focus on leadership, but the lessons are also applicable to all kinds of relationships. While we're often taught that effective leaders should be intimidating and run on scarcity and fear, Brown believes the opposite &#8212; that empathy, courage, and vulnerability are all hallmarks of successful, happy people.&#160;</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/online-social-psychology-classes-books'>Business Pugachevsky)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9b150a69331a0011bc6259?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn98@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-41-354_72a5678e0d022c9f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4f6e69331a0011bc6644?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-25-865_49eaf84d055062d3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4f8c69331a0011bc6646?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn47@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-32-633_c52a29a3988392da.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fa06f5b310011724821?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn64@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-33-582_9138bae64fe071f6.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fb369331a0011bc6649?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn65@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-38-826_aaf0cdf9ca963e60.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fcf6f5b310011724824?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn27@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-36-971_85e4b5e7fc85888a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4fe06f5b310011724825?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn58@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-26-023_da8459ae09163d3e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c4ff069331a0011bc664a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-33-640_587ccb64f3ed0de3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c50046f5b310011724827?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-35-096_93a37cb672921757.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c501369331a0011bc664d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn100@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-33-817_27ab9bbbf8f4caa5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c502069331a0011bc664e?format=jpeg":null,"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=rMumKqgz35Q:Ax6SWXvCeDY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn19@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-27-078_6f46e35a5b21fe03.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=rMumKqgz35Q:Ax6SWXvCeDY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn1@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-37-450_e7206fdac796e2d6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=rMumKqgz35Q:Ax6SWXvCeDY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn92@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-27-380_242d4bebbbe02ec7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/rMumKqgz35Q":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn23@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-36-059_fb3909476f2c9865.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167083},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Most Arab Americans plan to vote for Joe Biden but support for Trump has also grown among Arab American Republicans, according to a new poll","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/arab-american-voters-favor-joe-biden-in-the-us-election-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9cb9a66f5b310011724a72?format=jpeg\" alt=\"2020 10 25T224354Z_460837848_RC2YPJ91ICVS_RTRMADP_3_USA ELECTION HARRIS.JPG\" height=\"2880\" width=\"5760\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden is likely to receive more of the Arab American vote than President Donald J. Trump, according to the Arab American Institute.</li>\n<li>Biden's leading margin with Arab Americans may be smaller than Hillary Clinton's in 2016, and Arab American turnout is expected to be high.</li>\n<li>The Biden campaign and the Trump campaign have made late pitstops in Michigan, directly and indirectly focusing messaging on the Arab American community.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Most Arab American voters plan to vote for Joe Biden over Donald J. Trump in the 2020 election, according to a&#160;<a href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gE6glciSLc3MByJUcMixO0591PGVixHb/view\">new poll</a> conducted in the second week of October by the Washington, DC-based Arab American Institute (AAI).&#160;</p><p>The study, which was completed by 805 respondents, indicated that 59% of Arab Americans polled support Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden and 35% support President Donald J. Trump. The poll also asked respondents questions about foreign and domestic policies related to both candidates.</p><p>Trump's support among Arab American Republicans has grown, according to AAI. In 2016 the polling found that 58% of Arab American voters supported Hillary Clinton and 25% supported Donald Trump, showing that this year, his percentage points jumped up 10%.&#160;</p><p>A separate <a href=\"https://www.ispu.org/public-policy/american-muslim-poll/\">poll</a> by the Institute for Social Policy and Understanding correlated the findings that support for Trump among conservative American Muslims has increased since 2016.&#160;</p><p>The majority of respondents to AAI's poll, though, showed strong backing for Biden on the issues and disapproval of Trump's handling of various issues, from the pandemic to protests for racial justice. A quarter of those supporting Biden stated that they were voting for the former Vice President in opposition to Trump, as opposed to directly supporting the Biden campaign.</p><p>Overall, Arab Americans who responded showed that their greatest concerns this election year were ranked as race relations, then the faltering economy, and third, healthcare, as the pandemic continues. Seventy percent of those polled said that they viewed the nationwide demonstrations supporting Black Lives Matter in a positive light.</p><p>Respondents also relayed that Palestine, \"meeting the humanitarian concerns of the Syrian people,\" and addressing the political and economic crisis in Lebanon, were the top areas of concern on international issues. By a margin of two to one, Trump was seen as being more ineffective than effective in addressing polled domestic and foreign policy issues. Most respondents answered that Biden could improve relations with the Arab world.</p><p>The AAI also found that turnout will likely be high for Arab Americans in this election, particularly in Michigan, where Arab Americans could make up 5% of the electorate. More than 80% responded that they were likely to vote, as the Trump and Biden campaigns make their final pitch across the crucial swing state.</p><p>Last week, Jill Biden spoke to Arab American activists and community members in Dearborn, Michigan, in front of the iconic Shatila Bakery, an Arab bakery and community mainstay which has been around since the 1970s. There, she spoke about the US being a \"nation of immigrants\" and claimed that Joe Biden's vision included Arab American communities. Senator Kamala Harris, Biden's vice-presidential pick, also campaigned on the ground, speaking to Arab voters in Dearborn.</p><p>On Friday, in Michigan, Trump again touted his support in the Chaldean Iraqi community, a Christian minority that played a helpful role in the 11,000 vote lead which tipped Trump over the edge in Michigan in 2016. The Chaldean community has experienced a subsequent wave of deportations by ICE throughout Trump's presidency, including the case of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/detroit-man-died-after-being-deported-to-iraq-attorney-says-2019-8\">Jimmy Aldaoud</a>, a 41 year old Iraqi national who had never lived in Iraq. Aldaoud was deported to Iraq, without family on the ground or insulin for his diabetes, and later died, homeless in Baghdad.&#160;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"><strong>snacks</strong></a><strong>, and <a </strong></li><li><strong>If you're considering which streaming services offer the best movies for your family's viewing preferences, you can try out <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Disney Plus</a>, </strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com/?id=35871X943606&isjs=1&jv=14.0.0-alpha.1-stackpath&sref=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.businessinsider.com%2Fhow-to-get-hulu-for-free&url=https%3A%2F%2Fhulu.com%2Fstart%2Faffiliate%3Fcmp%3D8869&xguid=01E3A7H9PHAGJ3X27ARF61HCNS&xs=1&xtz=240&xuuid=c234322a0bf61e8bdff44460aeb10a0dc234322a0bf61e8bdff44460aeb10a0d\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Netflix</strong></a><strong> through their free trial periods.</strong></li></ul><p>Movie night is a big event in our house, and one of the few activities our schedule allows us to enjoy together almost every week. Besides dedicated family time, what makes it special is the setup. The first task is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-shows-disney-plus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">finding a flick</a> we can all agree on, although we usually take turns picking one to watch on the big screen. After that is the next most important step: snacks, usually some combo of popcorn, candy, and cookies. Then, settle in, park it a comfortable chair, wrap up in cozy blanket, and watch the show.&#160;&#160;</p><p>If you're looking to make your family movie night into a running tradition, it's important to settle on a few essentials that will make it easy, except for maybe deciding what to watch. Below are some suggestions we've collected to help you enjoy a trip to the theater without leaving the comfort of home.</p><h2>Here are 13 things to make a great family movie night at home:</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tThe popcorn, of course\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c686369331a0011bc672c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lekue popcorn maker\" height=\"1124\" width=\"1498\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Popcorn is the best part about a trip to the theater, besides the movie itself. The Lukue Microwave Popcorn Popper makes it easy to recreate that experience &#8212; just add kernels and set the cook timer for two to three minutes. Unlike the bagged stuff, you won't be stuck with a bowl full of unpopped kernels either. It's also easy to clean and small enough to stow away in the cabinet. If you want something a little bigger, there are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-popcorn-maker\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">plenty of options available</a>.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5db2f89edee0190409681702\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5db2f89edee0190409681702&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tPopcorn buckets\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c6dd969331a0011bc675d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"westbend popcorn bucket\" height=\"1500\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Target</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>You can leave your popcorn in the bowl, or you can dish it out into one of these novelty popcorn containers that look just like the tubs you'd get at the theater. This way everyone can have the flavor they want too.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f9c6c4e8fc3970c6162408d\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f9c6c4e8fc3970c6162408d&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tDelicious low-sugar candy you and your kids will love\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c6f4a6f5b310011724937?format=jpeg\" alt=\"perfect snacks peanut butter cups\" height=\"510\" width=\"681\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Target</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Finding the right candy to go with salty popcorn is the holy grail of movie snacking, but if you overdo it with too much sugar, it throws the whole thing out of balance. Besides, giving the kids anything too sweet before bedtime is never a good idea. Perfect Snacks Peanut Butter Cups have a lower glycemic index than most candy bars to keep everyone focused on the show and not bouncing off the walls. If you'd rather have a chocolate bar or sour candies, there are plenty of other tasty, low-sugar <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/healthy-halloween-treats\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">treats out there</a>.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f7f2034acfefb57003e88d3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f7f2034acfefb57003e88d3&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tCookies that taste great and even have some nutritional value\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c71ee69331a0011bc677f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"lenny larry chocolate chip cookie\" height=\"525\" width=\"700\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Lenny &#38; Larry</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Just because a cookie isn't loaded with empty calories doesn't mean it has to taste like cardboard. Each of these cookies from Lenny &#38; Larry comes packed with 16 grams of protein and 8 grams of fiber. There are other flavors available too, in case chocolate chip isn't you're favorite.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f9c71901e1b35294b304f8f\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f9c71901e1b35294b304f8f&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tRefreshing beverages for everyone\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c949269331a0011bc6892?format=jpeg\" alt=\"tervis disney pixar alien tumbler\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tervis</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>You've got the popcorn and candy &#8212; now you need something to wash it down with. Whatever you're drinking, a set of Tervis Tumblers will keep everything cold for the entire movie. They're also durable to the point of being virtually indestructible, so there's no worry about pausing the move to clean up broken glass. You can get them in a variety of colors or even with some of your favorite movie characters.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f9c954597b2550a6e7722e3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f9c954597b2550a6e7722e3&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tThe perfect seat for kids\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c77266f5b310011724979?format=jpeg\" alt=\"big joe dorm chair\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Walmart</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Getting kids to sit still for the entire length of a film can be a challenge, unless you have one of these bean bag chairs. They melt right into its armchair shape, glued there for the next 120 minutes. It's lightweight, so you can carry it anywhere in the house, and large enough for a teenager.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e7e1fa5487c226b776b24b2\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e7e1fa5487c226b776b24b2&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tA TV that gives you the theater experience\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef34f59191824699547edd7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"TCL 6-Series Roku TV\" height=\"450\" width=\"600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>These days it's not hard to find fantastic values on large TVs with glossy high-definition picture quality, like this 65-inch model from TCL for less than $800. Besides the HD 4K resolution, what's great about this one is that it puts Netflix, Hulu, Disney+, and other streaming services in one place with the built-in Roku software, and it's easy enough to use that you might not have to ask the kids to set it up for you. There are other great options if you're looking for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-tv-under-500-dollars\">something a little smaller or less expensive</a>, like <a href=\"https://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Ftcl-43-class-4-series-4k-uhd-smart-roku-tv%2F6427886.p%3FskuId%3D6427886\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">TCL's 43-inch Class 4 Series 4K UHD Smart Roku TV for just $230</a>.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e0a649a855cc210b60312c8\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e0a649a855cc210b60312c8&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tA projector that can make any wall into a movie screen\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e7e27e91378e378bd54f018?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Projector\" height=\"872\" width=\"1162\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Walmart</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>The great thing about a projector is that you can turn any place in the house, or outside it, into a theater &#8212; all you need is a flat wall. This one connects to a DVD or <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-4k-blu-ray-player\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Blu-Ray player</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-gaming-console\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">gaming consoles</a>, or even smartphone or tablet. And there's almost no limit to how big you can make projections. This one can go as large as 14 feet from corner to corner, as long as you have enough to space and a dark enough room.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e7e26d62d41c16ad71095ac\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e7e26d62d41c16ad71095ac&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tBig sound in a small package\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c8c1d69331a0011bc6876?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Vizio soundbar\" height=\"742\" width=\"990\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Vizio</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p style=\"margin: 0in;\">While TVs have evolved, their sound systems often aren't all that great. One minute, you'll be straining to hear a conversation; the next, a deafening action sequence starts. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-soundbar\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Soundbars</a> are a great option for most home theaters because they don't take up much space, they're easy to set up, and they deliver an awesome audio experience. Vizio's 36-inch SB362An-F6 is a 2.1 channel model that uses Dolby and DTS technologies along with a pair of built-in subwoofers for a deep stereo sound that will fill most living rooms. It's also a great value. If you're set on a more robust <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-home-theater-system\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">surround sound speaker system</a>, there are plenty of options.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e1361a9855cc24a7c52ec85\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e1361a9855cc24a7c52ec85&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tLights that make your screen stand out and save your eyes\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c87a36f5b310011724a1d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"luminoodle color bias lighting\" height=\"1050\" width=\"1400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>A simple adhesive strip of LED lights that attaches to the back of your television can really make your home theater pop. The light helps reduce eye strain, so your eyes don't have to adjust between the dark room and the screen. This set from Power Practical comes with a wireless remote to adjust the colors to boost the picture contrast too.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f9c889651467206a36cfbc3\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f9c889651467206a36cfbc3&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tA luxurious plush throw at a matinee price\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c866f6f5b310011724a15?format=jpeg\" alt=\"llbean_wicked_plush_throw\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">L.L.Bean</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>One thing you can't do at the theater is snuggle up under a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-throw-blanket\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">warm throw blanket</a> with someone you love. L.L.Bean's Wicked Plush Throw is incredibly soft thanks to brushed fleece on both sides, and it's made to the exacting standards you expect from one of our favorite heritage brands. It's also machine washable, which comes in handy wherever kids and snacks intersect.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e0e526c855cc214b61b53bd\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e0e526c855cc214b61b53bd&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tMatching family pajamas make movie night an event\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c827e69331a0011bc6824?format=jpeg\" alt=\"star_wars_pajamas\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hanna Andersson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p style=\"margin: 0in;\">It's not unusual to see fans in costumes for the latest Star Wars or Marvel movie, so why not recreate that experience at home, too, but with <a href=\"https://hanna-andersson.8ne3.net/c/196318/388344/5644?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hannaandersson.com%2Ffamily-match-characters%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">matching pajamas</a>. Even better, everyone's ready for bed when the credits roll. Sleep sets featuring characters like <a href=\"https://hanna-andersson.8ne3.net/c/196318/388344/5644?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hannaandersson.com%2Ffamily-match-characters-marvel-fairisle%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Marvel Fairisle</a> and <a href=\"https://hanna-andersson.8ne3.net/c/196318/388344/5644?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hannaandersson.com%2Ffamily-match-characters-star-wars-mandalorian%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">\"The Mandalorian\"</a> start at $42 for kids at Hanna Andersson, and you can find plenty of other options at <a href=\"https://goto.target.com/c/196318/81938/2092?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.target.com%2Fc%2Ffamily-pajamas%2F-%2FN-4yyte\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Target</a> and <a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&#38;sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fcp%2Fchristmas-family-pajamas%2F4114611\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Walmart</a>. PJ's from <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/primary-kids-baby-clothes-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Primary</a>&#160;are another great option if you're looking for something that's not specific to a movie franchise.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5f9c8536977c4373b875a342\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5f9c8536977c4373b875a342&type=button&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div>\n\tA small, powerful heater to warm up the screening room\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5e7e3e2092e19103c3021ab6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Space Heater\" height=\"775\" width=\"1034\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Walmart</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p style=\"margin: 0in;\">If you're struggling to get the temperature right in your home theater, a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-space-heater\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">space heater</a> can take the edge off the chill, whether you're in the basement or just needing a break from winter. Despite a svelte 4-pound frame, this one cranks out plenty warmth on three different settings. It's also got an automatic shutoff feature in case you forget about it when the show's over.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e7e44a0671de038b917ca73\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How to add OneDrive to the File Explorer in Windows 10, so that you always have access to your saved files","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-onedrive-to-file-explorer","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c81676f5b3100117249ea?format=jpeg\" alt=\"young man using laptop computer at home headphones\" height=\"1153\" width=\"2306\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It only takes a moment to add OneDrive to the File Folder.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Morsa Images/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can add OneDrive to the File Explorer in Windows by connecting your account to the computer.</li>\n<li>When you log into OneDrive on your PC, you'll be asked to choose a OneDrive folder to connect to Windows.</li>\n<li>Adding OneDrive to your computer's File Explorer will let you easily add or remove files from OneDrive.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Over the last few years, Microsoft has tightly integrated <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive</a>, its cloud storage service, into Windows. Using OneDrive used to be a cumbersome pain — now, OneDrive is built right into Windows, and can be used automatically.</p><p>As soon as you install OneDrive on a PC and set up your account, you should see OneDrive and all its subfolders in the File Explorer.&#160;</p><p>Here's how to make sure OneDrive will appear.</p><h2><strong>How to add OneDrive to the File Explorer</strong></h2><p>To see your OneDrive files in the File Explorer, you need to link your computer to your OneDrive account.&#160;</p><p><strong>1. </strong>Click the Start search box and type \"OneDrive.\" When OneDrive appears in the search results, click it.&#160;</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Enter the email address that's associated with your OneDrive account and click \"Sign in,\" and then enter your password. If you don't have a OneDrive account, you'll need to make one.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c7c7469331a0011bc67eb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to add OneDrive to File Explorer 1\" height=\"900\" width=\"1181\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Start the OneDrive app and sign in with your OneDrive credentials.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3. </strong>Follow the instructions to choose your OneDrive folder. If you've previously signed into OneDrive on this PC, you might have an existing OneDrive folder. In that case, you can click \"Use this folder.\"</p><p>When you're done, your OneDrive files will appear in File Explorer. You can now move files in and out of OneDrive easily.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c7e0b6f5b3100117249cc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to add OneDrive to File Explorer 2\" height=\"953\" width=\"1416\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>After configuring OneDrive, you&#39;ll see an entry for OneDrive in File Explorer.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a 2020 02:21:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f8e1844c21cfb0019468eae?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"73259f657ab2a1a35b21d4811769d967","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn9@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-26-020_65daeedad99059e0.webp","destWidth":2488,"destHeight":1866,"sourceBytes":228538,"destBytes":228538,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c81676f5b3100117249ea?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn63@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-34-203_efdf0251dd60c0cd.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c7c7469331a0011bc67eb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn28@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-27-146_5905a70e078a27f0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c7e0b6f5b3100117249cc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn84@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-34-407_140d925a61054fd9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ALsyNv1MnGM:yuww9ObPQsA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn20@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-29-443_0466bd73afe666e0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ALsyNv1MnGM:yuww9ObPQsA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn51@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-34-153_c395e05b8d2450e2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ALsyNv1MnGM:yuww9ObPQsA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn76@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-246_e4c49a53677bd795.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ALsyNv1MnGM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn32@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-34-736_945174aecf47ff7a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167104},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Twitter allows New York Post account to tweet again after contested Hunter Biden story led the company to update hacked materials policy","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-new-york-post-account-reinstated-hunter-biden-policy-update-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f775ffb74fe5b0018a8ec7c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"twitter logo\" height=\"1334\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jaap Arriens/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><a href=\"https://twitter.com/TwitterSafety/status/1322298208236830720\">Twitter said</a> on Friday that the New York Post's account \"can now tweet again\" after initially locking the account for violating its hacked materials and private information policies.</li>\n<li>Twitter <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-revises-hacked-materials-policy-uproar-ny-post-hunter-biden-2020-10?r=ts-sub\">updated the hacked materials policy</a> earlier this month after facing backlash over its decision to restrict the New York Post and other accounts from sharing a contested story purporting to show corruption by Joe Biden and his son Hunter.</li>\n<li>Twitter said Friday it would now allow accounts to appeal enforcement actions made under old policies \"if the account at issue is a driver of that change,\" adding that the New York Post qualified under that new standard.</li>\n<li>Cybersecurity experts told Business Insider that Twitter's updated hacked materials policy still gives hackers plenty of opportunities to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-ny-post-hunter-biden-hacked-material-rules-exploitation-2020-10?r=ts-sub\">find loopholes and exploit the new rules</a>.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Twitter <a href=\"https://twitter.com/TwitterSafety/status/1322298208236830720\">announced</a> Friday that the New York Post's Twitter account can now tweet again, reversing previous enforcement action it had taken against the media outlet for violating its hacked materials policy, which Twitter has since updated.&#160;</p><p>Twitter originally <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/jack-dorsey-ny-post-remains-locked-out-twitter-hunter-biden-2020-10\">blocked the @nypost account</a> for sharing a link to a dubious New York Post story that contained content that Twitter said violated its policies against sharing hacked materials as well as private information. The company also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-ny-post-hunter-biden-violated-doxxing-hacked-materials-policies-2020-10?r=ts-sub\">blocked other users from sharing links</a> to the story amid <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-post-hunter-joe-biden-giuliani-red-flags-disinformation-2020-10?r=ts-sub\">concerns about the story's veracity and source</a>.</p><p>Following backlash over that decision, Twitter <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-revises-hacked-materials-policy-uproar-ny-post-hunter-biden-2020-10?r=ts-sub\">updated its hacked materials policy</a>, saying it \"will no longer remove hacked content unless it is directly shared by hackers or those acting in concert with them\" and will add contextual labels to tweets with links to such material instead of blocking them entirely.\"</p><p>On Friday, Twitter said it would also end its \"practice of not retroactively overturning prior enforcement.\"</p><p>\"Decisions made under policies that are subsequently changed &#38; published can now be appealed if the account at issue is a driver of that change. We believe this is fair and appropriate,\" Twitter added, saying restrictions like the ones it placed on the New York Post's account can now be appealed.</p><p>\"Because a specific @nypost enforcement led us to update the Hacked Materials Policy, we will no longer restrict their account under the terms of the previous policy and they can now Tweet again,\" the social media giant said.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;New York Post  (@nypost) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1322304510736371713?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Twitter said the previous policy, which had been in place since 2018, was meant to avoid incentivizing hacking by allowing its platform to be a channel for distributing \"possibly illegally obtained materials.\"</p><p>But Professor Alan Woodward, a cybersecurity expert at the University of Surrey, told Business Insider's Isobel Asher Hamilton that hackers may have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-ny-post-hunter-biden-hacked-material-rules-exploitation-2020-10?r=ts-sub\">plenty of room to exploit the new boundaries</a>.</p><p>\"The danger seems to be that hacked material could easily be leaked by a third party who could at the very least be sympathetic to the hackers. By reserving the ban to hackers and those acting in 'concert' with the hackers it leaves a yawning gap that is bound to be exploited,\" he said.</p><p>Friday's announcement marked a reversal from Twitter's previous position that the New York Post would need to delete the original offending tweet before it could tweet again.</p><p>That tweet contained a link to a story the New York Post published on October 14 purporting to show an email of Hunter Biden communicating with a Ukrainian official about meeting with his father, Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden, when he was vice president.</p><p>The story had&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-post-hunter-joe-biden-giuliani-red-flags-disinformation-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"f3cc8eec3e1d2a758772441086d87987\">several red flags</a>, including how the Post obtained the materials and whether they were legitimate.&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/new-york-post-may-have-identified-hunter-biden-source-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"80\" data-uri=\"c65aa8ae255d6a81514d68ccd054bf9d\">Business Insider</a>, along with other sites, identified the source of the email who, according to The Daily Beast, repeatedly changed his story when laying out the timeline of how he obtained the information.</p><p>Facebook had also moved to&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-new-york-post-hunter-biden-shared-thousands-after-restrictions-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4ef3d1dcc53df6e5b9f02c0a21f98eb3\">restrict the circulation</a>&#160;of the article while it was fact-checked.</p><p>But Twitter's actions in particular sparked outcry from conservatives who accused it of political bias.</p><p>\"I find this behavior stunning but not surprising from a platform that has censored the President of the United States,\" Republican Sen. Josh Hawley wrote in a letter to Twitter. (The First Amendment does not prohibit private companies from limiting speech, only the government.)</p><p><strong>Read more: </strong><em><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/top-tech-policy-people-washington-lobbyists-google-facebook-amazon-twitter-2020-7?r=ts-sub\">Big Tech is in the hot seat in Washington. Here are the 19 most influential people shaping policy for the industry from the nation's capital.</a></em></p><p>CEO Jack Dorsey <a href=\"https://twitter.com/jack/status/1316528193621327876?s=21\">previously apologized</a> for Twitter's lack of communication around the company's response, calling it \"unacceptable.\"</p><p>Twitter has locked prominent users out of accounts in the past. Dorsey previously&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-campaign-account-locked-twitter-ny-post-biden-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"5b853227ce1d7a6d2766094647fd8db4\">locked the official Twitter account for President Donald Trump's reelection campaign</a> after it posted clips relating to the Hunter Biden story. Twitter also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-locked-president-trump-account-shared-email-2020-10\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"2af7d927d0860c0e73a4607abcc089c3\">locked Trump's account</a> after it shared the email address of a New York Post columnist praising him for battling the coronavirus.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/twitter-new-york-post-account-reinstated-hunter-biden-policy-update-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=J9m5vjiR_i0:KZjPs2DA4HY:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J9m5vjiR_i0:KZjPs2DA4HY:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/J9m5vjiR_i0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 31 Oct 2020 00:03:51 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f63dcec57b7da001ee12600?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"202fac2bde2141b6349f985ca5c658b3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn35@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-25-978_8099cad113012929.webp","destWidth":2220,"destHeight":1665,"sourceBytes":90832,"destBytes":90832,"author":"tsonnemaker@businessinsider.com (Tyler Sonnemaker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f775ffb74fe5b0018a8ec7c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn43@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-28-164_f6740700fc6cd4fd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J9m5vjiR_i0:KZjPs2DA4HY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn8@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-27-524_b324297f6459a76f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J9m5vjiR_i0:KZjPs2DA4HY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn11@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-455_002a1ee4d80c1e9d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=J9m5vjiR_i0:KZjPs2DA4HY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn71@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-28-360_4cd4602f06403c71.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/J9m5vjiR_i0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn14@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-36-839_bc512c9c9c77c282.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167075},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"CDC officials are considering a plan to distribute COVID-19 vaccines to the most vulnerable first — including people of color","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-official-considering-giving-covid-19-vaccine-most-vulnerable-first-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c95496f5b310011724a5c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"covid vaccine\" height=\"1292\" width=\"2585\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A photo illustration show a syringe. Argentina was selected to test a vaccine against COVID-19, it is estimated that the clinical phases will begin in August.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Carol Smiljan/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Experts at the Centers for Disease Control are considering a plan that would distribute vaccines to the most vulnerable in the population first, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/30/world/covid-19-coronavirus-updates?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=HomepageHomepage\">The New York Times</a> reported.&#160;</li>\n<li>The plan would look to set aside vaccines to distribute in highly hit areas, usually areas that have a large population of people of color.&#160;</li>\n<li>People of color have seen higher rates of infection and death from COVID-19.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Experts advising the Director of the Centers for Disease Control are looking at a measure that would widely distribute a COVID-19 vaccine first to the highest hit areas, usually, areas with a large percentage of people of color, <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/10/30/world/covid-19-coronavirus-updates?action=click&module=Top%20Stories&pgtype=HomepageHomepage\">The New York Times</a> reported.&#160;</p><p>The CDC advisory group said it would be just and fair to set aside the limited supply for this group since that have been disproportionately impacted by the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>\"I see this as a seismic shift,\" Harald Schmidt, an assistant professor of medical ethics and health policy at the University of Pennsylvania told The Times. \"We can't go back to colorblind allocation.\"</p><p>Business Insider <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-racial-gap-in-coronavirus-deaths-is-driven-by-racism-2020-6\">previously reported</a> that Black Americans and people of color have been infected with and have died from COVID-19 at a much higher rate. There are a number of factors for this including already prevalent health disparities. African-Americans and those of color have a higher rate of underlying conditions due to \"structural factors including health care access, density of households, unemployment, pervasive discrimination, and others,\" <a href=\"https://ehe.amfar.org/inequity?_ga=2.51214761.1618924293.1588715818-1730120696.1588715818\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"40\" data-uri=\"eb4b5625f19cd4adf73607d9e7ecdf4f\">one study found.</a></p><p>\"Opportunity and exposure are not equally distributed, especially by race, in this country,\" Dr. Camara Jones, an&#160;<a href=\"https://www.radcliffe.harvard.edu/people/camara-phyllis-jones\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"8d9f9aa210afd4ce28189395f71f9cf1\">epidemiologist and physician with affiliations</a>&#160;at Morehouse, Emory, and Harvard universities, told Business Insider.</p><p>Additionally, people of color were more likely to be more <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/black-americans-unemployment-coronavirus-layoffs-disproportionately-high-april-bls-data-2020-6\">represented in public-facing jobs that were deemed essential.</a></p><p>The proposed vaccine distribution plan has the US divided into four groups. When supplies are short, the first phase of distribution would go to a group comprised of health care workers including nursing assistants and others working in nursing homes. The next group to get access to the vaccine would be essential workers not in healthcare. This group would include teachers, people in homeless shelters, and people who either work or are housed in correctional facilities. People older than 65 or who have pre-existing conditions could also a vaccine in this phase.&#160;</p><p>The next two phases would be rolled out to people who have less risk to COVID-19.&#160;</p><p>The Times reported that no vaccine plan would be voted on until the Food and Drug Administration either fully approves a vaccine or gives one emergency use authorization.</p><p>Once a vaccine is approved, <a href=\"https://www.poynter.org/reporting-editing/2020/the-virus-vaccine-challenge-overcoming-mistrust-from-black-americans/\">as Poynter reports</a>, the medical community will have to work to gain the trust of the Black community — due to historical mistrust after the mistreatment of Black men in the Tuskegee syphilis trials.</p><p>Dr. James E. K. Hildreth, from the historically Black Meharry Medical College in Nashville, told Poynter that he's taking part in one of the vaccine trials to try to send a signal to the community.</p><p>\"I am going to be trying to convince people in minority communities that they should participate in a vaccine trial,\" he said. \"I'm doing it to make the strongest statement possible, that I'm confident of the safety of the vaccines and I'm going to be in one of the studies myself.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-official-considering-giving-covid-19-vaccine-most-vulnerable-first-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Trump mocks Fox News host Laura Ingraham for wearing a mask at his campaign rally and calls her 'politically correct'","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-mocks-fox-news-host-laura-ingraham-face-mask-rally-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c74dc69331a0011bc6798?format=jpeg\" alt=\"President Donald Trump gives Laura Ingraham a kiss after inviting her on stage during the Turning Point USA Student Action Summit at the Palm Beach County Convention Center, Saturday, Dec. 21, 2019, in West Palm Beach, Fla.\" height=\"706\" width=\"1255\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>President Donald Trump with Laura Ingraham during the Turning Point USA Student Action Summit on December 21 in West Palm Beach, Florida.\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP Photo/Luis M. Alvarez</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>President Donald Trump on Friday made fun of the Fox News host Laura Ingraham for wearing a face mask at a campaign event in Michigan.&#160;</li>\n<li>\"I can't recognize you. Is that a mask? No way. Are you wearing a mask? I've never seen her in a mask,\" Trump said. \"Look at you. Oh, she's being very politically correct.\"</li>\n<li>The president has consistently criticized mask-wearing, a scientifically proven COVID-19 mitigation technique, and most of his rally attendees don't wear face coverings.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>President Donald Trump mocked the Fox News host Laura Ingraham, one of his most influential media boosters, for wearing a face mask at his Friday campaign rally in Waterford Township, Michigan.&#160;</p><p>During an off-script portion of his speech, the president mentioned that Ingraham was at the rally and looked around to point her out to the crowd. But Trump quickly pounced on Ingraham when he saw that she had donned a face mask.&#160;</p><p>\"I can't recognize you. Is that a mask? No way. Are you wearing a mask? I've never seen her in a mask,\" Trump said. \"Look at you. Oh, she's being very politically correct. Whoa. Whoa.\"</p><p>Trump has regularly criticized mask-wearing, despite scientific evidence proving it an effective way to curb COVID-19 transmission, and has mocked others for wearing face masks. The president routinely makes fun of Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden for wearing a mask, even after Trump, the first lady, and several campaign and White House staffers contracted the virus.&#160;</p><p>Trump has also repeatedly spread false claims and <a href=\"https://int.nyt.com/data/documenttools/evanega-et-al-coronavirus-misinformation-submitted-07-23-20-1/080839ac0c22bca8/full.pdf\">misinformation about the virus</a>, including that American doctors are fabricating COVID-19 deaths, scientists have developed \"miracle cures\" for the virus, and the pandemic is \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-says-us-rounding-turn-covid-19-even-cases-surge-2020-10\">rounding the turn</a>.\"</p><p>\"If you get it, you're going to get better,\" Trump told his supporters at Friday's rally. \"And then you're going to be immune, and it's a whole thing, and it goes away.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;The American Independent  (@AmerIndependent) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1322236283285024768?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Meanwhile, the US is grappling with the worst coronavirus outbreak in the world. On Friday, the national caseload crossed 9 million, and more than 229,000 people have died of the disease, <a href=\"https://gisanddata.maps.arcgis.com/apps/opsdashboard/index.html#/bda7594740fd40299423467b48e9ecf6\">according to data compiled by Johns Hopkins University</a>.</p><div (Eliza Relman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c74dc69331a0011bc6798?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn88@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-26-166_c60bbae4db862e33.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hHX1qc0bNME:GFA0-ENZyjA:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-38-535_855130dfa7cc3dc3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hHX1qc0bNME:GFA0-ENZyjA:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn35@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-33-265_a8aeeae8db41da9c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=hHX1qc0bNME:GFA0-ENZyjA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn97@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-36-823_6d09e6ebe1dc4fb3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/hHX1qc0bNME":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn36@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-30-967_e825d6b78ad37166.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167094},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Insider Retail: Dunkin' in acquisition talks, furloughed Nordstrom employees forced to pay back health insurance fees, and fast food brands get innovative","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/dunkin-in-acquisition-talks-panera-adds-pizza-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f998bd96f5b310011723d7e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 1183898633\" height=\"2336\" width=\"3114\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Halloween costumes for pets are flying off shelves as Americans seek joy in the pandemic.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Chelsea Guglielmino/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Hello and happy Friday!&#160;</p><p>While our (virtual) newsroom has been abuzz with all-things election-related this week, the retail team has been working hard to ensure you don't miss a beat in the world of restaurants and retail. And since this week was an especially big week for Dunkin', may we suggest grabbing a celebratory donut (or two) after hitting the polls?&#160;</p><p>With that, I welcome you to another week of Insider Retail, Business Insider's weekly round-up of everything that's happening in retail news. If you haven't already subscribed, <a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/click/19921095.876/aHR0cDovL25ld3NsZXR0ZXIuYnVzaW5lc3NpbnNpZGVyLmNvbS9qb2luLzRucC9kcml2ZXRocnU_bnJfZW1haWxfcmVmZXJlcj0xJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9U2FpbHRocnUmdXRtX21lZGl1bT1lbWFpbCZ1dG1fY29udGVudD1Ecml2ZVRocnU/5c818d302ddf9c27c19a8b1aB1c4ef4a7\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"5901ad8f7cccd9431e67aec97e07ce1c\">click here</a> to get me, Bethany Biron, and my colleague, Shoshy Ciment, in your inbox every Friday.&#160;</p><p>Looking for even more quality time with the retail team? Lucky for you, you can hang out virtually with my colleagues Gloria Dawson, Catherine LeClair, and Madeline Stone on <strong>Thursday,&#160;November 12, from 12-1:30 p.m. ET</strong> for <a href=\"https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg30.jsp&partnerref=editorial_newsletter_inclusion&eventid=2704927&sessionid=1&key=1C39BAD57EADFA3B26654C4F8B528E58&regTag=&sourcepage=register&#38;sourcepage=register\">IGNITION: A Retail Revolution</a><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\">. </strong>Join us for the event, sponsored by Salesforce, to hear from retail entrepreneurs, executives, technologists, and investors about the state of the industry and their predictions for 2021. Register <a href=\"https://event.on24.com/eventRegistration/EventLobbyServlet?target=reg30.jsp&partnerref=editorial_newsletter_inclusion&eventid=2704927&sessionid=1&key=1C39BAD57EADFA3B26654C4F8B528E58&regTag=&sourcepage=register&#38;sourcepage=register\">here</a>.</p><p>Alright, time for some news:</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dunkins-potential-acquisition-by-arbys-inspire-brands-explained-2020-10\">Inspire Brands eyes $9 billion acquisition of Dunkin' and Baskin-Robbins&#160;</a></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9b3c3e6f5b310011724554?format=jpeg\" alt=\"dunkin donuts\" height=\"3331\" width=\"4441\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">AP/Mark Lennihan</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Inspire Brands is plotting to expand its sprawling fast-food empire, and its <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dunkin-baskin-robbins-deal-inspire-brands-bought-dunkin-brands-group-2020-10\">latest target is Dunkin' Donuts</a>.</p><p>The company — which owns Arby's Buffalo Wild Wings, Sonic Drive-In, Jimmy John's, and Rusty Taco — is currently in talks to acquire Dunkin' Brands, which owns Dunkin' and Baskin-Robbins, for $8.8 billion.&#160;</p><p>The beloved New England-based brand has <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dunkin-pandemic-leadership-strategy-david-hoffmann-2020-10\">expanded rapidly in recent years</a>, and today boasts 13,000 global locations, including around 8,000 Baskin-Robbins restaurants, which operate as franchise sites. Beyond dropping the \"Donuts\" from its title in 2018, the company has evolved to include major menu revamps such as adding trendy beverage items like matcha and oat milk.&#160;</p><p>Mark Kalinowski, CEO of Kalinowski Equity Research, told Business Insider's Kate Taylor this week that purchasing Dunkin' is a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dunkins-potential-acquisition-by-arbys-inspire-brands-explained-2020-10\">smart move for Inspire</a> as it looks to integrate a coffee chain to its portfolio, with the added bonus of bringing in significant cash flow and maintaining steady business during a particularly tumultuous period for restaurants.</p><p>\"[Inspire has] become experts over the years in acquiring and integrating other concepts — and making the sum of the parts greater than the individual concepts involved,\" Kalinowski said. \"There are not that many large coffee-centric quick-service brands out there to go around. So if you want to play heavily in the coffee category, your options are limited.\"</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nordstrom-says-workers-need-pay-it-back-for-health-insurance-2020-10\">Nordstrom is forcing previously furloughed workers to pay back health insurance fees&#160; &#160;</a></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9b3b2769331a0011bc6346?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FILE PHOTO: The Nordstrom store is pictured in Broomfield, Colorado, February 23, 2017.REUTERS/Rick Wilking\" height=\"2181\" width=\"2908\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>FILE PHOTO: The Nordstrom store is pictured in Broomfield\n<p class=\"copyright\">Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>When Nordstrom furloughed store workers in April, it told them their health-insurance benefits would still be in place even though they wouldn't be getting a paycheck.</p><p>However, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/nordstrom-says-workers-need-pay-it-back-for-health-insurance-2020-10\">as Madeline reported this week</a>, some store workers say they didn't realize they would have to pay Nordstrom back for the premiums the company covered.</p><p>While Nordstrom asserts it did in fact tell employees about the stipulation at the onset of the furloughs, the staffers say otherwise, pointing to murky communication between the company and its employees.&#160; &#160;</p><p>For many penny-pinched Americans, an unexpected paycheck deduction could have devastating effects. According to a Bankrate survey of <a href=\"https://www.bankrate.com/banking/savings/emergency-savings-survey-2020/\">more than 1,000 American adults</a> in July and August, 21% of respondents said they currently have no emergency savings, and just one in five said they have enough saved to cover up to five months of expenses.&#160;</p><p>\"We kind of assumed that that was the company being generous, as it is very often in certain situations,\" said one employee, who works at a Nordstrom store in Illinois and asked to remain anonymous for fear of jeopardizing his job.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/panera-debuts-pizza-in-pandemic-2020-10\">Panera debuts pizza</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/burger-king-tim-hortons-upgrade-10000-drive-thrus-tech-2020-10\">Burger King tests high-tech drive-thrus</a>, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wendys-new-chicken-sandwich-promotion-coupon-how-to-get-free-2020-10\">and Wendy's tries to reignite the chicken sandwich wars</a></h2><p>It was a jam-packed week of news for fast food chains.</p><p>First, White Castle announced not only is it implementing <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/white-castle-adds-more-flippy-robot-cooks-2020-10\">robot cooks to make burgers</a> and fries to select locations, but it's also giving employees <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/white-castle-closes-restaurants-on-election-day-workers-vote-2020-10\">paid time off to vote</a> on Election Day — a rare move among its restaurant peers. Then, Wendy's rolled out a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/wendys-new-chicken-sandwich-promotion-coupon-how-to-get-free-2020-10\">new chicken sandwich</a>, designed to rival the likes of Popeyes and Chick-fil-A, and reignite the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/popeyes-chicken-sandwich-started-civil-war-customers-2019-11#:~:text=The%20tension%20between%20Popeyes%20and,Chicken%20Sandwich%20War%20of%202019.\">chicken sandwich wars of 2019</a>.</p><p>That wasn't all. Looking to capitalize on the pizza boom during the pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/panera-debuts-pizza-in-pandemic-2020-10\">Panera added</a> flatbread pizzas to its menu, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/taco-bell-grilled-cheese-burrito-loss-of-potatoes-boost-profits-2020-10\">Taco Bell reported</a> massive sales growth thanks to the popularity of its Grilled Cheese Burrito, and Burger King is experimenting with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/burger-king-tim-hortons-upgrade-10000-drive-thrus-tech-2020-10\">high-tech predictive menus at drive-thrus.</a></p><h2>Everything else you need to know</h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f998ada6f5b310011723d76?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages 617296472\" height=\"2525\" width=\"3367\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by STR/NurPhoto via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li>Americans can't stop buying <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pet-halloween-costumes-are-on-the-rise-in-pandemic-2020-10\">pet Halloween costumes</a> in an attempt to feel a fleeting moment of joy during the pandemic.&#160;</li><li>Starbucks' Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/starbucks-pumpkin-cream-cold-brew-outsells-pumpkin-spice-latte-2020-10\">outsold the Pumpkin Spice Latte</a> after the chain debuted its fall drink menu earlier than ever this year.</li><li>Major companies like Danone and General Mills are gearing up to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/these-food-and-beverage-brands-could-be-next-to-dissappear-2020-10\">offload food and beverage brands</a> as the coronavirus outbreak wages on.&#160;</li><li>Amazon announced it will <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-hiring-100000-seasonal-workers-before-holidays-2020-10\">hire 100,000 seasonal workers</a> to assist with the holiday rush.&#160;</li><li>Hotel chains are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/butler-hospitality-makes-ghost-kitchens-hotel-room-service-2020-10\">turning to ghost kitchens</a> to help curb costs.&#160;</li><li>The RealReal is bringing its luxury consignment business <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/the-realreal-expands-to-midwest-as-luxury-consignment-market-grows-2020-10\">to the Midwest</a>.</li><li>Consumers are already starting to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/retail-holiday-shopping-season-deal-fatigue-coronavirus-2020-10\">feel \"deal fatigue\"</a> as companies double down on e-commerce and launch extended holiday discount periods.&#160;</li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/dunkin-in-acquisition-talks-panera-adds-pizza-2020-10'>Business
