href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=gm4aOQKmPM4:JWfcRIchbbU:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=gm4aOQKmPM4:JWfcRIchbbU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gm4aOQKmPM4:JWfcRIchbbU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/gm4aOQKmPM4\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Oct 2020 20:40:57 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c56ff69331a0011bc6695?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e9d2176c4c0915baa90a9c4a9aa2469b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn31@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-27-145_56b66e77864da723.webp","destWidth":964,"destHeight":723,"sourceBytes":52162,"destBytes":52162,"author":"oseddiq@insider.com (Oma Seddiq)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c56fb6f5b310011724865?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn52@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-38-724_54e7861502feb75b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gm4aOQKmPM4:JWfcRIchbbU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-31-475_5c4eda9960eb8501.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gm4aOQKmPM4:JWfcRIchbbU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn97@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-25-976_a3f7566f60d4ba3a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=gm4aOQKmPM4:JWfcRIchbbU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-41-616_e28cbb6dece0388c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/gm4aOQKmPM4":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn24@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-30-175_98ae059523ad5871.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167091},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"This creepy 'haunted' Zoom call uses deepfakes to put words in your mouth — and serves as a powerful warning about the threats posed by cutting-edge misinformation techniques","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/take-this-lollipop-2-ai-deepfakes-cybersecurity-misinformation-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c68c06f5b3100117248fe?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Take this lollipop\" height=\"691\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A Halloween video uses a Zoom call and deep fakes.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Take This Lollipop 2</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Filmmakers have created a chillling interactive video that features looming figures in a video conference and deepfakes of viewers.&#160;</li>\n<li>The on-screen experience creates a videoconference call in which a figure appears behind viewers, and viewers appear to say things they didn't as their likeness is manipulated.&#160;</li>\n<li>The filmmakers say the project shows how easily deepfakes can be created, representing a real cybersecurity concern &#8212; this kind of technology can be used to spread misinformation in ways that have never been seen before.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In a creepy Halloween online experience, videomakers have created a self-described \"interactive Zoom horror film\" that uses the very familiar 2020 setting of a video conference call to make a figure loom behind viewers onscreen, and re-create viewers saying things they didn't say. (The faked dialogue starts off with just small talk, but builds to a twist I won't spoil here.)</p><p>Filmmakers Jason Zada and Jason Nickel created <a href=\"https://takethislollipop.com/\">the website</a> where viewers can take part in a video that is something of a sequel to a 2011 film that connected viewers via Facebook and pulled their personal data into the story. That video, \"Take This Lollipop,\" generated hundreds of millions of views.</p><p>The 2011 digital film experience asked viewers to click a button that read \"connect via Facebook,\" then harnessed their social media information to seemingly show a terrifying villain stalking them. The point was to show the dangers of giving your personal information too recklessly online. See a short recap <a href=\"https://nyl.as/t1/101/2q2a8xvix1nh79gd5p1jx7fww/9/002bd27842faee308226637484be4644bfb30ba2cd369b7d2cd550a60fc550e3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://nyl.as/t1/101/2q2a8xvix1nh79gd5p1jx7fww/9/002bd27842faee308226637484be4644bfb30ba2cd369b7d2cd550a60fc550e3&source=gmail&ust=1604166675896000&usg=AFQjCNEixdrnD4VlvFoiWJ8JImkVdauOvA8JImkVdauOvA\">here</a>.</p><p>The video&#160;<a href=\"https://www.post-gazette.com/lifestyle/2012/03/27/Take-This-Lollipop-site-sticks-with-SXSW-judges/stories/201203270237\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.post-gazette.com/lifestyle/2012/03/27/Take-This-Lollipop-site-sticks-with-SXSW-judges/stories/201203270237\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">won three awards</a> at South By Southwest in 2012. But while critics loved it, the filmmakers say Facebook was concerned — and that the company's lawyers called them to make sure the video didn't misuse data. We've reached out to Facebook for comment.</p><p>The new version looks at video conferencing and the use of <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/deepfakes-explained-the-rise-of-fake-realistic-videos-online-2019-6\">deepfakes</a>, highly realistic videos that create likenesses of people or create nonexistent people on video. Cybersecurity experts say deepfakes can be used to manipulate viewers – for instance by spreading misinformation by putting words in politicians' or celebrities' mouths.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"Real life is turning out to be quite scary these days, so we wanted to really put people into an everyday situation that we all know well and turn the tables a bit. Technology in the wrong hands can allow anyone to digitally manipulate small amounts of footage and become someone else. That thought was something that really stuck with us,\" says Zada, a film and commercial director who wrote and directed the experience.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"While the experience is harmless, the threats are real. Deepfakes, chatbots with advanced AI, identity theft – these are all things that are currently happening,\" Zada said.</p><p dir=\"ltr\">Nickel, head of video company of <a href=\"http://imposium.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://imposium.com&source=gmail&ust=1604170807537000&usg=AFQjCNHH65NVgUdBtMY4v2reKw0VFdqAOgreKw0VFdqAOg\">Imposium</a>, built the experience. He says re-creating a person on camera – as happens in the video – is \"surprisingly simple.\"&#160;</p><p dir=\"ltr\">\"We used open-source software in this case, and just a little bit of video from the experience, to create a passable clip just to show people what's possible. But apps like Reface are able to deep fake you in real time, so that's another example of how powerful this technology is. It's only a matter of time before we see the next phase of identity theft on a whole new scale.\"&#160;</p><p dir=\"ltr\">The filmmakers say they are running the website \"as our financial resources can pay for the server fees. We're just a team of independent people doing this all on our own.\"</p><p dir=\"ltr\">Participants can buy a download of their video for $2, but participation is free. You can watch your humble correspondent's experience here:&#160;</p><p><iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/KQhyZ5a1qxs\"></iframe></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/take-this-lollipop-2-ai-deepfakes-cybersecurity-misinformation-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:V_sGLiPBpWU\" src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/JaibvtymuA0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Oct 2020 21:48:38 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c690a69331a0011bc6732?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"47f4e27acbba02d0fa271908ecacef1c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn33@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-26-040_361bc6d919171623.webp","destWidth":441,"destHeight":331,"sourceBytes":6772,"destBytes":6772,"author":"jelder@businessinsider.com (Jeff Elder)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c68c06f5b3100117248fe?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn4@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-31-639_d31c9af2472ada78.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn3@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-334_e56b930e2c0ec0b5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn13@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-37-540_c5a88c709e9f3719.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=JaibvtymuA0:SKGjg8nNPRQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn51@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-28-247_9bed090ee1400afd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/JaibvtymuA0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn12@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-35-256_d712eb145691feed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167085},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How to delete a Google Classroom course, or archive it to keep its data and grades","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-delete-google-classroom","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99e55669331a0011bc5f04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Google Classroom app on an Android phone resting on a Mac laptop\" height=\"1477\" width=\"2955\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can delete a Google Classroom class on any platform.\n<p class=\"copyright\">SOPA Images/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li><strong>You can delete a Google Classroom class once it's over or canceled.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Before you can delete a Google Classroom class, you'll need to \"Archive\" it, which is essentially a way to deactivate it.</strong></li>\n<li><strong>Any instructor can archive a class, but only the head teacher can delete it.</strong></li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/google-classroom\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Google Classroom</a> acts as a virtual learning space, where teachers can hand out assignments, grades, and feedback to everyone in their class. Meanwhile, students in the class can turn in projects and track their progress along the way.&#160;</p><p>Then, when the Google Classroom class is over for the semester or school year, it can easily be deleted or archived.&#160;</p><p>If you're an instructor, you can archive any of your classes — this is essentially a way of saying the class is over, but preserving all the materials and items. And if you're the head teacher of a class, you can then delete it too.</p><p>Deleting a class will erase all posts and comments, although files can still be accessed by students who have a link to the relevant Google Drive folders.</p><p>Here's how to archive and then delete Google Classroom classes on desktop, iPhone, iPad, or Android devices.</p><h2><strong>How to archive and delete Google Classroom classes on Mac or PC</strong></h2><h3><strong>To archive a class:</strong></h3><p><strong>1. </strong>Visit <a href=\"https://classroom.google.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">classroom.google.com</a> and log into your account, then find the class you want to archive. Remember that you need to be an instructor in the class.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Tap the three vertical dots on the upper-right corner of the class card you wish to archive.&#160;</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Click \"Archive\" to confirm your choice.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99e2936f5b310011724118?format=jpeg\" alt=\"how to delete a google classroom 1\" height=\"809\" width=\"607\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can archive any class you&#39;re an instructor in.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>To unarchive a class, click on the three horizontal lines in the upper-right corner of the Google Classroom dashboard, and then select \"Archived classes.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99e3f96f5b310011724120?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to delete a google classroom 2\" height=\"433\" width=\"453\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Open the &#34;Archived classes&#34; page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>On the archived class card, click the three vertical dots on the upper-right corner and then click \"Restore.\"&#160;</p><h3><strong>To delete a class:</strong></h3><p><strong>1. </strong>First archive the class using the steps above, and open the \"Archived classes\" page.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Find the card for the class you want to delete, and click the three dots in its upper-right corner.</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Select \"Delete.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99e4256f5b310011724121?format=jpeg\" alt=\"how to delete a google classroom 3\" height=\"715\" width=\"752\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can delete archived classes that you&#39;re the head teacher of.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to archive and delete Google Classroom classes on iPhone or iPad</strong></h2><h3><strong>To archive a class:</strong></h3><p><strong>1. </strong>Open the Google Classroom app on your device and log into your account.&#160;</p><p><strong>2. </strong>On the class card for the class you wish to archive, click the three horizontal dots (...).&#160;</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Tap \"Archive.\"&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99e44e6f5b310011724122?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to delete a Google Classroom 4\" height=\"1280\" width=\"720\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can also edit the class from here.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>To restore an archived class, tap the three horizontal lines in the upper-left corner of your app's screen and then tap \"Archived classes.\" On the class card, tap and choose \"Restore\" to bring the class back.</p><h3><strong>To delete a class:</strong></h3><p><strong>1. </strong>Archive the class, and then open the \"Archived classes\" page.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Tap \"Delete\" on the class card you want to delete.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99e47c69331a0011bc5f02?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to delete a Google classroom 5\" height=\"1280\" width=\"720\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Deleting a class will only take a few taps.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jennifer Still/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>How to archive and delete Google Classroom classes on Android</strong></h2><h3><strong>To archive a class:</strong></h3><p><strong>1. </strong>After opening the Classroom app and finding the class you want to archive, tap the three vertically stacked dots on the upper-right corner of the class card.&#160;</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Tap \"Archive,\" then \"Archive\" again to confirm.&#160;</p><p>To restore the archived class, tap the three horizontally stacked lines in the upper-left corner of the app. Then tap \"Archived classes,\" and once you see the class card, tap the three dots again before tapping \"Restore.\"&#160;</p><h3><strong>To delete a class:</strong></h3><p><strong>1. </strong>Follow the instructions above to archive the class, and then open the \"Archived classes\" page.</p><p><strong>2. </strong>Tap the three dots on the upper-right corner of the class you want to delete.</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Select \"Delete.\"</p><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-join-google-classroom\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" in to Google Classroom and access your course materials on a computer or mobile device</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-create-a-google-classroom\" device</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-leave-a-google-classroom\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to leave a Google Classroom on any 20_5/2020/10/31/07-26-25-866_f1f6688806ad9467.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167103},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Confidence 'has never been higher': Here's what 4 Wall Street banks had to say about Apple's fiscal 4th-quarter earnings","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-q4-earnings-reaction-iphone-sales-miss-services-mac-growth-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c3ebd6f5b3100117247ac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Tim Cook\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Stephen Lam/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul><li><strong>While investors balked at <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock\">Apple's</a> worse-than-expected quarterly iPhone sales, analysts are looking past the September quarter and largely optimistic about the company's future.</strong></li><li><strong>The tech giant <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-fiscal-q4-2020-earnings-iphone-sales-wearables-services-2020-10\">reported revenue and earnings on Thursday afternoon</a> that beat estimates, but <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/apple-stock-price-fiscal-q4-earnings-iphone-sales-miss-estimates-2020-10-1029746691\">its stock tumbled</a> as phone sales disappointed shareholders.</strong></li><li><strong>Analysts at major banks praised growth in Apple's computer and services segments and advised clients to buy shares while they're at relative lows.</strong></li><li><strong>Here's what four major Wall Street banks had to say about Apple's fiscal fourth-quarter report.</strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock\">Watch Apple trade live here</a>.</strong></li></ul><hr><p>Apple's <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-fiscal-q4-2020-earnings-iphone-sales-wearables-services-2020-10\">fiscal fourth-quarter report</a> left investors wanting. Wall Street isn't so concerned.</p><p>The tech giant's revenue and profit for the September quarter beat expectations, but all-important iPhone sales missed analysts' hopes. The shortfall and a lack of forward guidance dragged shares to their lowest in a month and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/apple-stock-price-fiscal-q4-earnings-iphone-sales-miss-estimates-2020-10-1029746691\">erased as much as $111 billion from Apple's market cap</a>.</p><p>Still, analysts are mostly optimistic about iPhone performance. Apple's new iPhone lineup debuted roughly one month later than usual, pushing revenue from the phones' release into the December quarter. With strength in services and Mac sales offsetting some of the recent iPhone slowdown, Wall Street largely expects reinvigorated phone orders to lift Apple to new heights.</p><p>Here's what four major Wall Street banks said about the report and Apple's trajectory.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-high-growth-stocks-2021-goldman-sachs-2020-10?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Goldman Sachs shares 10 high-growth stocks it newly recommends buying as investors reward companies that channel cash to grow their businesses in 2021</a></em></p><h2>Bank of America: Likely to 'temper some near-term enthusiasm'</h2><p>The previous quarter's mild beat and vague optimism about current-quarter performance will \"likely temper some near-term enthusiasm\" after Apple surged to a lofty valuation, analysts led by Wamsi Mohan wrote in a note. The new phones' later launch should bolster December-quarter sales and carry strong momentum into the following three-month period, they added. Still, lingering coronavirus uncertainties place hopeful forecasts at risk.</p><p>\"Management noted double-digit growth in all areas outside of iPhones with the expectation that the demand environment does not change materially due to COVID-19,\" the team said. \"Although management remains bullish on the iPhone cycle, our estimates for the cycle remain relatively unchanged.\"</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/bac-stock\">Bank of America</a> lowered its price target to $135 from $140 following the disappointing iPhone-sales reading, still implying a 17% rally from Thursday's close. Margins will improve in upcoming quarters, but gains will mostly offset the September quarter, the bank said, adding that its full-year estimates would stay the same.</p><p>Bank of America holds a \"neutral\" rating on the stock.</p><h2>Wedbush: 'On the cusp of its largest iPhone cycle' since 2014</h2><p>Though iPhone weakness drove Friday's sell-off, investors can rest assured that the new lineup will drive strong sales through the current quarter, Wedbush's Dan Ives said. Preorder activity is tracking at double the rate seen during last year's iPhone release, suggesting the 5G-capable lineup is \"off to a robust start,\" he said.</p><p>Couple the strong start with the roughly 350 million iPhone users due for an upgrade, and Apple seems to be \"on the cusp of its largest iPhone cycle since iPhone 6 in 2014,\" Ives said, adding that investors disappointed by the Thursday report should scoop up shares on any weakness.</p><p>Wedbush holds an \"outperform\" rating for Apple shares, with a price target of $150.</p><p><em><strong>Read more:</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-market-short-selling-andrew-left-explains-jumia-compass-bets-2020-10?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Famed short-seller Andrew Left told us about his bullish positions in a magic-mushroom company and a COVID-19 test maker — and explained why he's now all-in on an online retailer he bet against barely a year ago</a></em></p><h2>Morgan Stanley: Confidence 'has never been higher'</h2><p>Katy Huberty reiterated the call to buy, saying in a Friday note that she would be a buyer \"on any weakness post-earnings.\" Apple is entering the new fiscal year with its strongest lineup of products and services, with tailwinds from 5G, work-from-home demand, and growing adoption of digital services, she said.</p><p>Confidence in Apple's ability to \"retain existing users, attract new users, and accelerate growth and profitability has never been higher,\" Huberty added.</p><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/ms-stock\">Morgan Stanley</a> holds an \"overweight\" rating on Apple shares, with a price target of $136.</p><h2>Canaccord Genuity: 'Well-positioned to benefit from the 5G upgrade cycle'</h2><p>Instead of focusing on weaker-than-expected iPhone sales, investors should look at the bigger picture, T. Michael Walkley said.</p><p>\"The company is continuing to demonstrate the strength of its product ecosystem amidst the pandemic with strong double-digit growth for Macs, iPads, and services,\" he added.</p><p>The disappointing fourth-quarter figures will ramp into strong phone sales in the new fiscal year, the firm said. Apple is \"well-positioned to benefit from the 5G upgrade cycle\" as communications infrastructure continues to be built out, Walkley said. iPhone sales will accelerate the most in the fiscal second quarter, he added, as the case for 5G-capable phones strengthens.</p><p>Canaccord Genuity holds a \"buy\" rating on Apple, with a price target of $145.</p><p><em><strong>Now read more markets coverage from Markets Insider and Business Insider:</strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-election-investing-strategy-investors-cautious-gold-invesco-paul-jackson-2020-10\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Here's why a 34-year industry veteran has 'zero allocation' to gold for his $1.3 trillion asset manager employer ahead of the US election. He pinpoints 3 better ways to hedge against a contested result.</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/trades-outperform-biden-election-democratic-sweep-stimulus-morgan-stanley-2020-10-1029743395\" data-analytics-position=\"5\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Morgan Stanley details 3 trades set to outperform as investors grow more comfortable with a Democratic sweep</a></strong></em></p><p><em><strong><a 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Apple, Amazon, and Facebook shed $220 billion in market value as shares tank after earnings","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-amazon-facebook-alphabet-stock-price-tech-q3-earnings-2020-10","description":"<p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f7ae57a282c500018c78808?format=jpeg\" alt=\"iphone recycling\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Apple&#39;s iPhone sales slumped last quarter.\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Spencer Selvidge</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><ul><li><strong>Apple, Amazon, and Facebook shares slumped on Friday as investors expressed their dissatisfaction with the trio's earnings on Thursday.</strong></li><li><strong>Apple closed 5.6% lower, Amazon slumped 5.5%, and Facebook dropped 6.3%, wiping almost $250 billion off their combined market capitalizations.</strong></li><li><strong>Alphabet stock closed 3.8% higher </strong><strong>after Google's parent company posted earnings that blew away analysts' forecasts.</strong></li><li><strong>Scroll down for a brief look at each of the four companies' earnings.</strong></li><li><strong><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</strong></strong><hr></li></ul><p><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/aapl-stock\">Apple</a>, <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/amzn-stock\">Amazon</a>, and <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/fb-stock\">Facebook</a> shares tumbled on Friday after the technology giants <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/aapl-amzn-goog-fb-q3-earnings-big-tech-results-analysis-2020-10\">reported earnings on Thursday</a> that disappointed investors.</p><p>Apple closed 5.6% lower, Amazon dropped 5.5%, and Facebook slumped 6.3%. The stock-price declines erased almost $250 billion from their combined market capitalizations — more than the entire market cap of Disney ($219 billion), Netflix ($210 billion), or Coca-Cola ($207 billion).</p><p>Google-parent <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/googl-stock\">Alphabet</a>'s shares bucked the \"big tech\" trend, closing 3.8% higher after the group posted revenues and profits that crushed Wall Street's expectations. The stock-price increase added more than $40 billion to the group's market cap.</p><h2><strong>Here's a quick look at the four tech titans' earnings:</strong></h2><p><strong>Apple</strong>&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-fiscal-q4-2020-earnings-iphone-sales-wearables-services-2020-10\">grew</a> its net sales by 1% year-on-year to $64.7 billion in its fourth quarter to September 26. The increase reflected a 29% rise in Mac sales and a 46% jump in iPad sales, as millions of people turned to Apple products to work and study from home during the pandemic.</p><p>However, iPhone sales slumped 21% to $26.4 billion, and net sales shrunk 28% in Greater China. The result was a 7% drop in net income to below $13 billion. Apple also declined to offer financial guidance for the current quarter, disappointing investors hoping to gain a sense of management's expectations for the new iPhone 12.</p><p><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">Read More:</em></strong><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">&#160;</em><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stocks-to-buy-6-food-companies-halloween-candy-covid-bofa-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stocks-to-buy-6-food-companies-halloween-candy-covid-bofa-2020-10\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">BANK OF AMERICA: Buy these 6 food stocks best-positioned for stay-at-home Halloween celebrations as towns curb trick-or-treating</a></em></p><p><strong>Amazon</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-earnings-q3-2020-revenue-eps-profit-analysis-2020-10\">posted</a> a 37% rise in third-quarter net sales to $96.1 billion, as net product sales climbed 33% and net service sales surged 43%. Revenue jumped 29% to $11.6 billion in its cloud-computing division, AWS, generating $3.5 billion in operating income — more than half of Amazon's total operating income of $6.2 billion.</p><p>The e-commerce giant guided towards net sales growth of 28% to 38% this quarter. However, it also forecast operating income of $1 billion to $4.5 billion, indicating its profits could rise 15% or plummet 74% year-on-year.</p><p><strong>Facebook</strong> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/facebook-earnings-q3-2020-revenue-eps-profit-analysis-2020-10#:~:text=Facebook%20on%20Thursday%20reported%20%2421.5,Street's%20expectations%20of%20%2419.8%20billion.\">reported</a> a 22% increase in revenues to $21.5 billion last quarter, almost entirely driven by a 22% rise in advertising sales. The upshot was a 12% jump in operating income to $8 billion. The social-media giant also grew its daily and monthly active users by 12% year-on-year to 1.8 billion and 2.7 billion respectively.</p><p>However, Facebook also warned of \"significant\" uncertainty next year, as the accelerated shift to online shopping and digital-advertising boom during the pandemic might not last, and platform changes and new regulations could spell trouble for its business.</p><p><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\">Read More:&#160;</em></strong><em data-stringify-type=\"italic\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-high-growth-stocks-2021-goldman-sachs-2020-10\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/stock-picks-to-buy-high-growth-stocks-2021-goldman-sachs-2020-10\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Goldman Sachs shares 10 high-growth stocks it newly recommends buying as investors reward companies that channel cash to grow their businesses in 2021</a></em></p><p><strong>Alphabet</strong>'s third-quarter earnings <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-alphabet-earnings-q3-2020-advertising-cloud-youtube-other-bets-2020-10\">blew past analysts' expectations</a>. Revenues climbed 14% to $46.2 billion as Google search, Google and YouTube advertising, and Google Cloud all posted robust sales growth. The result was a 22% surge in operating income to $11.2 billion.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-amazon-facebook-alphabet-stock-price-tech-q3-earnings-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Uit-3rdViT0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Oct 2020 20:56:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9bdebb6f5b3100117245ca?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"3c171c7e5979cb2c5135f7e0e29e47f2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn39@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-25-977_13b0b47503157943.webp","destWidth":3053,"destHeight":2289,"sourceBytes":134676,"destBytes":134676,"author":"tmohamed@businessinsider.com (Theron Mohamed)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f7ae57a282c500018c78808?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn55@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-38-677_0304a7cb932ad581.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn99@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-28-488_e5b1b2cfde20beb7.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn44@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-32-654_8285f2812914b89a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Uit-3rdViT0:wpmNh2dCrCE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-25-965_a5ffe17a8b4a0062.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Uit-3rdViT0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn93@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-36-693_84aa95b21511adc1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167092},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"5 ways to motivate yourself when you're feeling stuck in a rut","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/5-ways-to-motivate-yourself-when-youre-feeling-stuck-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5b588da57d4dc734008b4664?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bored depressed\" height=\"1334\" width=\"1778\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It can be easy to get stuck in a rut and feel unmotivated during social isolation.\n<p class=\"copyright\">yougoigo/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/author/amy-morin\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Amy Morin</a>&#160;is a psychotherapist, licensed clinical social worker, mental strength coach, and international bestselling author.</li><li>During the pandemic, it's been easy for some people to fall into a mundane, day-to-day routine that can leave them feeling stuck or unmotivated.</li><li>Morin says to these feelings of boredom can be reduced by incorporating new habits into your schedule that you can look forward to.</li><li>She recommends making a list of fun activities that you can do at home, like trying a new recipe or workout video, and setting new goals that you want to achieve.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>A common reason people come to therapy is that they feel stuck. For some, feeling stuck is about boredom. Their daily habits have become mundane, and life seems so predictable it's become stale.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dd7ec2cfd9db2612c24f323?format=jpeg\" alt=\"amy morin psychotherapist\" height=\"1765\" width=\"2353\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amy Morin.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Amy Morin</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>For others, it's a feeling of being stuck in a specific situation — like a job they hate or a relationship that leaves them unfulfilled.</p><p>When you find yourself feeling stuck, you have to take action. But in the midst of a rut, this often feels impossible.</p><p>Fortunately, the following strategies can help you get out of a rut no matter how stuck you feel.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">1. Identify several escape routes</strong></h2><p>There are always many different solutions to a problem. Of course, not all of them are good solutions. But when you're first trying to look at how to get unstuck, brainstorm as many ideas as you can — even ones you think might be bad.</p><p>Create a long list of strategies that could help you escape your current situation. Include ideas that seem awful and ones that might seem impossible (at least for now). The goal is to create a long enough list that your brain will recognize you have plenty of options.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">2. Change your routine</strong></h2><p>While routines can be good for developing good habits — like going to the gym every day — having too much structure in your life could cause you to feel robotic. You need to change things up a bit to get out of the rut.</p><p>Doing things differently helps your brain look at matters from a new angle. It might spark new ideas, fuel a passion, or give you more energy.</p><p>You don't necessarily need to make huge changes — smaller ones can be effective too. Instead of eating dinner right when you get home from work, go for a walk. Or sign up for a class that will help you learn something new.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">3. Develop a challenge</strong></h2><p>Competition is a great way to add fuel to a dwindling fire. And you don't necessarily need to compete against anyone else. Instead, you can create a challenge that's just for you.</p><p>Your challenge could be related to a specific problem. If you're in a financial rut, you might challenge yourself to pay down $1,000 worth of debt in a month.</p><p>Or you could just create a challenge that gives you a goal to reach every day — like running a mile to see how fast you can do it. Running each day might give you something to look forward to, it could offer a sense of accomplishment, and it may spark new interests in other areas of your life.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">4. Design experiments</strong></h2><p>You don't have to commit to making a change that is going to last forever. Instead, you can design short-term experiments.</p><p>See if they make your life better or worse. If your experiment makes things better, stick to it. If it makes things worse, do something else.</p><p>You might design a small experiment like testing whether wearing a different type of clothing makes you feel differently about yourself. If your wardrobe change boosts your confidence, stick with it. If it doesn't, do something different.</p><p>Or you could test a different social media strategy for your business one week. If it gets you positive results, keep it up. If not, try something different.</p><p>Make it a goal to have a new experiment every week — whether it's social, business, fitness, or financial — and you'll find ways to improve your life.</p><h2><strong style=\"color: #000000;\">5. Switch up your social circle</strong></h2><p>The people you surround yourself with make a big difference in how you see yourself and the world around you. Switching up your social circle can be one of the fastest ways to get unstuck.</p><p>Look for ways to reconnect with people you've lost touch with, or find ways to meet new people. (This may be a good time to design an experiment if you aren't sure what to do.)</p><p>You also might have a few people in your circle that you want to subtract. If there are people dragging you down, limit your contact, or reduce their influence on your life. You might find this helps you feel a little less \"stuck\" too.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/5-ways-to-motivate-yourself-when-youre-feeling-stuck-2020-7'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a While crowded hotel pools don't sound too appealing right now due to COVID-19, secluded pools at private Airbnbs sure do. Of course, if you're looking for a simple above-ground pool solution for your own backyard, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-swimming-pool\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">we can help you out with that too</a>. Or, if you prefer an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-inflatable-hot-tub\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">inflatable hot tub for the winter, try one of these</a>.&#160;</p><p>If you're wondering <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">whether Airbnbs are safe</a> right now, we spoke with experts who said staying at an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/which-is-safer-airbnb-hotels-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Airbnb as opposed to a hotel</a> may actually be one of the safer options, especially if booking the entire house so there are no interactions with hosts or other guests.&#160;</p><p>Airbnb <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">also recently implemented new procedures</a> and cleaning policies, which include new protocols all hosts must now follow. However, there are still hosts going the extra mile and taking part in Airbnb's most stringent Enhanced Clean protocols.&#160;We've noted new cleaning policies for each listing below, but keep in mind that without a vaccine there's no guarantee of safety. Experts also advise guests that it may be wise to take extra precautions like bringing your own sheets and wiping down all surfaces yourself upon arrival.&#160;&#160;</p><p>If you're okay with those potential risks and inconveniences, then Airbnb can be a good option for a socially distant summer vacation. We also asked experts to weigh in on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-travel-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">other travel risks like renting a car, flying, and more</a>, so you can feel safe getting to your planned destination.&#160;</p><p>We strongly advise following guidelines and advice from organizations such as the CDC and WHO, and practicing safety measures including wearing a mask, washing your hands, and maintaining social distancing. It's also necessary to check travel restrictions and guidelines for the state you plan on visiting since many still have mandatory quarantines for out-of-staters.</p><p>With all that in mind, if you're ready to kick summer off by cannonballing straight into the deep end, we rounded up some excellent Airbnbs with pools across the country. We used the following criteria for our selections:</p><ol><li><strong>Airbnb listing is for the entire home (no awkward bathroom sharing situations).</strong></li><li><strong>All are highly-rated Airbnb listings with a rating of 4.8 or higher.</strong></li><li><strong>Listings include a private pool for guest use.</strong></li></ol><h2>Read on for 17 of the best Airbnbs with pools, sorted by price from low to high.</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tFarm cottage in Silver Creek, Georgia, $49\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c8d106f5b310011724a46?format=jpeg\" alt=\"airbnbs with private pools georgia\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F39226331%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604094621_QxS2vrl6mt2C2xa0\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Book this farm cottage starting at $49 per night</a></h2><p>Coming in at just $49 and located on an idyllic farm, this charming cottage with a private pool is a remote getaway away from the city bustle and a serious deal. Inside is expertly decorated with bright pops of yellow and plenty of plants. href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/airbnb-new-cleaning-protocol\">Enhanced Clean program</a>, meaning the host is committed to a rigorous cleaning protocol developed with leading health and hospitality experts.</p><h2><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/unique-airbnb-rentals-hudson-valley-beacon-new-york\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Find more Airbnbs in New York's Hudson Valley here</a></h2>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/best-airbnbs-with-pools-us'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8x5N1019UEw\" +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c7bf569331a0011bc67e7?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"a3681f788819cbe606a74d6dacb0d6d7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn71@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-27-238_60b4078ba612b8a2.webp","destWidth":2276,"destHeight":1707,"sourceBytes":278884,"destBytes":278884,"author":"hfreedman@businessinsider.com (Hannah Freedman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5ee90d65f34d05297f5b67a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn20@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-28-656_a11852c0388e2e54.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c8d106f5b310011724a46?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn56@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-30-551_4749978a5e14efa3.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90b73f0f419205146c16c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn59@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-28-814_56ab252361fac1a8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90c9e5af6cc7ec7393744?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn27@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-29-407_7874b4d7a04280ba.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90d3f988ee33f126947a4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn60@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-38-780_909e12b4b24b0f27.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90c3a5af6cc7eab486a89?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn4@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-29-363_16247f81f01b88a1.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90d07f34d052941147c94?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn48@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-37-090_3e91629dddf64c21.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90c1daee6a80788164915?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn47@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-33-355_4263c9c8ba343899.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90da2aee6a808614ccf97?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-37-903_e8d6d8b6a62f8f18.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eea755b19182439ca50d603?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn23@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-30-862_dcffad8c03b84c05.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90d69aee6a808373469d6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn68@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-32-692_1a8fdae95f4b2e3e.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90efaaee6a808f502ce72?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn23@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-31-658_3d20b883fdf98583.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ef24f31f34d052c60478b18?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn32@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-29-460_07d3ed0a3b841e98.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f28226c3ad8611e37497978?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn32@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-36-857_79a7b9c99c8f23b0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90dda988ee33f7f046ccb?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn11@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-31-645_034b5ed25f0c0d6a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5eea730bf34d05338f0736f8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn4@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-34-566_e31e5ee0613f896b.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90eb21918243a964c1415?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn26@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-28-936_995622713cd08786.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90e7e4dca681c8d645a49?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn78@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-37-328_50179c0d61699839.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ee90e404dca681c8d645a43?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn76@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-29-034_50098574f19f947d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn71@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-34-346_a2869990f67d0717.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn51@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-31-955_781d550d1eccedb9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=8x5N1019UEw:I7M-jowU9mU:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn43@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-37-910_26115e71df5cd3b2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/8x5N1019UEw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn39@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-32-623_475c8c08dde02c3e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167103},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"I've sent more than 200 cold emails over the course of my career and only been rejected 3 times. Here are 6 rules I follow to get the attention of people I admire.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-send-cold-emails-rules-that-wont-be-ignored-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5d7001d32e22af4b785ed247?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Michael Thompson\" height=\"2849\" width=\"3799\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Michael Thompson.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Michael Thompson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Michael Thompson is a career and communication coach who helps business executives and entrepreneurs be successful by making the right connections.</li><li>He says he's reached out to more than 200 people via cold email throughout his career with great success — only three people declined to meet with him.</li><li>Thompson recommends first reaching out to friends of friends, then making sure your email has a clear purpose and thinking about what you can offer before asking for any favors.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>I've never found a \"hack\" for success more effective than this one, a piece of advice I used to hear all the time from my dad: The best way to get what you want is by getting to know the people who already have it.</p><p id=\"ad88\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">It's advice I've relied on throughout my career. Over the years, I've reached out to well over 200 people doing things I thought were cool, requesting a chance to speak with them. Only three people have declined my invitation to talk. (Well, technically four — Oprah never got back to me.) This&#160;<a href=\"https://forge.medium.com/youll-never-get-what-you-want-if-you-re-too-scared-to-ask-for-it-ec3c0c210a4d\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">practice of cold-emailing</a>&#160;has helped me build a professional tribe that has become a place for support, connection, and more opportunities than I ever thought possible.</p><p id=\"dfb8\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">At a time when everyone is dealing with a lot, the ability to craft an email that not only gets read but gets a positive response is an increasingly valuable skill. Here's what I've learned about how to do it well.</p><h2 id=\"2e53\"><strong>Don't begin by trying to call Oprah</strong></h2><p id=\"4e5c\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">If I learned anything from my experience of reaching out to strangers, it's that&#160;<a href=\"https://forge.medium.com/how-to-like-people-more-bf99b6cf4c74\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the world is full of incredibly talented people</a> who can help you grow.</p><p data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">You don't need Oprah, Bill Gates, Tim Ferriss, or any other high-profile figure who will definitely never see your request to \"put some time on their calendar.\" Start smart by identifying friends of friends who are doing cool things.</p><p id=\"1ef0\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">Don't limit your list to people who are in your exact field, either. Breakthroughs often come when you surround yourself with people who view things through a different lens.</p><h2 id=\"7754\"><strong>Your subject line matters</strong></h2><p id=\"e3ff\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">After you've made a list of people to reach out to, it's time to craft your email. The subject line \"Friend of [mutual friend's name]\" is a solid option, but it's not the only one.</p><p data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">In one&#160;<a href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/3036672/what-we-learned-from-sending-1000-cold-emails\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">experiment</a>, the entrepreneur and author Shane Snow found that simple subject lines like \"Quick question\" net strong results when you're reaching out to new people. (Marketers, however, are starting to use this subject line more often, so its effectiveness may be waning.)</p><p id=\"d9ef\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">For me personally, the subject line \"Thank you\" has consistently been the most effective in starting conversations. (We'll talk about how you should thank the person in your email in a bit.) People don't write thank-you notes as much as they say they do. This simple act will help you to stand out without showing off.</p><h2 id=\"eb92\"><strong>Know your 'North Star'</strong></h2><p id=\"0bdf\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">When I first started becoming more serious about my writing, the speaker and entrepreneur&#160;<a href=\"http://www.twitter.com/conorneill\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Conor Neill</a> gave me this advice: When drafting an article, write at the top of the page: \"After reading this, I want the reader to ________?\" He told me to use this question as my \"North Star\" to guide my writing.</p><p id=\"b3d1\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">You can apply this same strategy to writing your email. Have one clear agenda, even if it's simply to try to get them on a call so you can learn more about them. Make sure your goal is clear so the message you send supports exactly what you're looking to accomplish.</p><h2 id=\"3780\"><strong>Embrace the 'Rule of 7'</strong></h2><p id=\"b7bb\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">One of the oldest principles in marketing is the \"<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-many-contacts-does-it-take-before-someone-buys-your-product-2011-7?IR=T#:~:text=A%20good%20starting%20point%20for,within%20an%2018%2Dmonth%20period.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Rule of 7</a>,\" which states that a prospective customer needs to be exposed to an advertiser's message seven times before they will take action.</p><p data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">This doesn't mean that if you send an email and don't get a response you should follow up six more times (please don't do that). But it does mean that a person will be more open to an email from you if they're somewhat familiar with your name.</p><p id=\"5dd4\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">Play with ways to get your name in front of them before making that initial direct contact. Sharing their work on social media is one way to do this. If you have a blog, you can write a post that mentions how their work has positively affected you and then tag them on Twitter, thanking them for the inspiration. Get creative. Just don't do too many things at once, too close together, or you risk turning them off.</p><h2 id=\"eb5f\"><strong>Show them what their work has helped you achieve</strong></h2><p id=\"6fb5\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">Successful people get a lot of fan mail and requests to chat. To help your email stand out, make it clear that you've been following their work for a while (instead of just gushing over the latest thing that went viral) and that it has impacted you in a specific way.</p><p data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">You can use the formula: \"Thanks to your work doing X, I've been able to accomplish Y.\"</p><p data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">I like to pull out a small detail from their work that has made my life easier. For instance, I've always admired the energy and sense of humor that&#160;<a href=\"https://okdork.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Noah Kagan</a>, the founder of&#160;<a href=\"https://appsumo.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">AppSumo</a>, brings to his work. But instead of giving him this generic message, I recently let him know I was writing an article about something he had mentioned in passing on a podcast — his \"<a href=\"https://forge.medium.com/get-yourself-a-holy-shit-jar-6136ea18dbf8\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Holy S--t Jar</a>\" — and asked him how I could best link to his work. We didn't automatically become best friends after that, but we do have plans to talk.</p><h2 id=\"e22d\"><strong>Before asking for a favor, think of how you can help them</strong></h2><p id=\"751c\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">To really forge a connection, it's important to let the person know that building a relationship with you would be mutually beneficial. Maybe that person is writing a book and you can be a part of their launch team. Or perhaps they're starting a business and your work as a designer can help them to create a more persuasive website. One of the best habits you can form is to ask yourself every day how you can make the lives of the people around you better.</p><p id=\"75c2\" data-selectable-paragraph=\"\">This advice isn't foolproof — some people are busy, while others may not be prioritizing meeting new people at the moment. But keep at it. When you grow your network, you expand your world.</p><p data-selectable-paragraph=\"\"><em><a href=\"http://www.linkedin.com/in/mikethompsonblog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.linkedin.com/in/mikethompsonblog&source=gmail&ust=1600877736032000&usg=AFQjCNFXurXpxSyJcm8BU1CviNUpKE2dswCviNUpKE2dsw\">Michael&#160;Thompson</a> is a career strategist who works with business professionals and entrepreneurs to open more doors and receive greater satisfaction from their work. His work regarding all things communication and career advice has been featured in Business Insider, Fast Company, Apple News, The Ladders, and Forbes. He currently resides in the Catalan countryside with his wife and their two cool little boys. He writes to meet people, so reach out to connect with him <a href=\"https://mikethompsonblog.com/subscribe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=https://mikethompsonblog.com/subscribe&source=gmail&ust=1600877736033000&usg=AFQjCNF3EGHFbAMvO0DaW1d4woA6ZQooSwd4woA6ZQooSw\">here.</a></em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-send-cold-emails-rules-that-wont-be-ignored-2020-7'>Business Insider</a></div><div border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=PuF5MWfDNVY:6zxPxvA-78w:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=PuF5MWfDNVY:6zxPxvA-78w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=PuF5MWfDNVY:6zxPxvA-78w:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/PuF5MWfDNVY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 31 Oct 2020 01:57:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d7001d32e22af4b785ed247?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"0314e99cbbe523fd335bd4b5fc388bc4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn92@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-24-352_e8d22aee61b555a0.webp","destWidth":3799,"destHeight":2849,"sourceBytes":230220,"destBytes":230220,"author":"insider@insider.com (Michael Thompson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d7001d32e22af4b785ed247?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn92@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-24-352_e8d22aee61b555a0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=PuF5MWfDNVY:6zxPxvA-78w:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn81@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-37-362_339f163dc0056a8f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=PuF5MWfDNVY:6zxPxvA-78w:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn23@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-32-492_095e2c3c138887bd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=PuF5MWfDNVY:6zxPxvA-78w:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn56@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-37-075_9e3710518e855666.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/PuF5MWfDNVY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn47@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-31-166_5534bbdb8b4139b3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167104},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How to sign into your OneDrive account in Windows 10 to access all of your saved files","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-sign-into-onedrive","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c74d56f5b310011724960?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman using laptop\" height=\"757\" width=\"1514\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to sign into OneDrive.\n<p class=\"copyright\">FG Trade/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can sign into OneDrive simply by opening the OneDrive app on your PC.</li>\n<li>If you don't have a OneDrive account to sign into yet, you can create a free account with 5GB of storage space, or subscribe to Microsoft 365.</li>\n<li>The OneDrive app is installed on every Windows 10 computer by default, but if you don't have it, you can install it for free.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Before you can use <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/onedrive\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Microsoft OneDrive</a>, you need to sign into your account and link it to your Windows computer.&#160;</p><p>After you do that, any files stored in the OneDrive folder on your PC will be automatically synchronized with the cloud (up to your storage limit, of course).&#160;</p><p>Whether you're new to OneDrive or need to link a new computer to your existing account, signing in is essentially the same.</p><h2><strong>How to sign into OneDrive on a PC</strong></h2><p>OneDrive is included with all new copies of Windows 10 by default. But if you're using an older version of Windows, OneDrive might not be built in. If you can't find OneDrive through the steps below, you probably need to <a href=\"https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/onedrive-desktop-app-for-previous-versions-of-windows-850703dd-ea56-4c7a-bff5-6c2e4da227cf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">install it first</a>.&#160;</p><p><strong>1. </strong>Click the Start search box or press the Windows key + Q and type \"OneDrive.\" When you see OneDrive appear in the search results, click it.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c71b569331a0011bc677c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign into OneDrive 1\" height=\"1338\" width=\"2378\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Open the OneDrive app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2. </strong>If you have an account, enter the email address associated with your OneDrive account and click \"Sign in.\"&#160;</p><ul><li>If you don't already have a OneDrive account, you can get a free one (which includes 5 GB of online storage) or sign up for a OneDrive subscription. You can sign up for any of the OneDrive plans, including the free plan, on the <a href=\"https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/onedrive/compare-onedrive-plans?activetab=tab%3aprimaryr1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">OneDrive website</a>, or you can sign up by clicking \"Create account\" in the OneDrive program window.&#160;</li></ul><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c71da6f5b310011724948?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign into OneDrive 2\" height=\"892\" width=\"1188\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>If you&#39;re new to OneDrive, create a free account from the OneDrive app&#39;s sign-in page.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3. </strong>On the next page, enter your password. If you previously set up two-factor authentication for your Microsoft account, you might need to enter an extra code sent to your phone or email, too.</p><p><strong>4. </strong>Follow the instructions to choose your OneDrive folder. If you were previously signed into OneDrive on this PC, you might have an existing OneDrive folder. You can click \"Use this folder\" instead, then.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c722c69331a0011bc6780?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How to sign into OneDrive 3\" height=\"889\" width=\"1206\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>If a OneDrive folder already exists on this computer, you can use it to start syncing files again, or you can choose a new location to start fresh.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Tech Reference</a>:</strong></h2><ul><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-delete-files-from-onedrive\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to delete files from OneDrive storage in 2 different ways, and remove them from all of your connected devices</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-share-files-on-onedrive\" data-analytics-position=\"2\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to share files and folders on OneDrive on a PC in several different ways</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-disable-onedrive\" data-analytics-position=\"3\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to disable Microsoft OneDrive permanently or temporarily, and uninstall it from your PC</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-transfer-files-from-pc-to-pc\" data-analytics-position=\"6\" data-analytics-module=\"\">How to transfer files from one PC to another PC in 3 different ways</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-download-photos-from-icloud-to-pc\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\" data-uri=\"f751afdd6822e9495d82f59db4f6874e\">How to download photos from your iCloud onto your PC through the iCloud website</a></h3></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article
