15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp tests negative for COVID-19 but is quarantining following exposure to the virus","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-gov-brian-kemp-quarantining-following-covid-19-exposure-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c5f8a69331a0011bc66dc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Georgia Governor Brian Kemp\" height=\"2036\" width=\"4072\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Georgia Governor Brian Kemp speaks during a dedication of the state&#39;s new Nathan Deal Judicial Center in Atlanta on February 11, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\"><a href=\"http://www.apimages.com/metadata/Index/Virus-Outbreak-Georgia-Election/7d86961a77eb4607b24160e1b8b971a6/18/0\" target=\"_blank\">AP Photo/John Amis</a></p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp is in quarantine after being exposed to someone who contracted the coronavirus, his office announced Friday.</li>\n<li>Kemp spokesman Cody Hall said both Kemp and his wife Marty took tests for the virus, and the governor later released a statement saying he tested negative but will continue quarantining.</li>\n<li>Drew Ferguson, a Republican congressman who was with Kemp at a Trump campaign event on Tuesday, tested positive for the virus, the Associated Press reported.</li>\n<li>It remains unclear if Kemp, who has been criticized for taking a lax approach to his state's outbreak, was exposed at that rally or elsewhere.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp is quarantining following his exposure to someone who contracted the coronavirus, his office announced Friday.</p><p>The governor's office did not initially disclose Kemp's coronavirus test result when they announced he was quarantining, though spokesman Cody Hall confirmed both Kemp and his wife Marty took a test, according to the <a href=\"https://apnews.com/article/virus-outbreak-public-health-georgia-113d4b21f19cd18b173c80c3c6ea7eb1\">Associated Press</a>.</p><p>Kemp later issued a statement saying his first test came back negative and he is not experiencing any symptoms, but that he will continue quarantining. The first lady also tested negative.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Governor Brian P. Kemp  (@GovKemp) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1322255022730694662?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">October 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>Drew Ferguson, a Republican congressman from Georgia who was with Kemp at a Trump campaign rally on Tuesday, has tested positive for the coronavirus, according to a different announcement on Friday, AP reported.</p><p>Kemp has taken a laissez faire approach to the pandemic, earning praise from President Donald Trump and criticism from medical experts.</p><p>Georgia has seen more than 7,900 deaths from COVID-19, and their case total is over 356,000, based on data compiled by Johns Hopkins University. The positivity rate in the Peach State, which is the sixth hardest hit in the US, is over 7%.</p><p>Kemp has put himself at the center of the nation's coronavirus debate on several occasions, such as when he <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-gov-brian-kemp-offers-to-host-republican-national-convention-2020-5\">volunteered his state to host the Republican National Convention</a>&#160;after Trump soured on North Carolina's crowd restrictions.</p><p>The governor was also <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/georgia-to-open-gyms-nail-salons-bowling-alleys-and-more-on-friday-2020-4\">aggressive in his reopening plans</a>, with places like gyms, nail salons, and bowling alleys allowed to let customers back inside as early as mid-April.</p><p>Kemp is one of several Republican governors who have experienced precipitous <a href=\"https://www.usnews.com/news/politics/articles/2020-07-24/republican-governors-see-approval-ratings-drop-as-coronavirus-outbreak-worsens\">drops in their approval ratings</a> as their states have taken more lax approaches to the pandemic.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a through Election Day, popular reading app <a href=\"https://www.scbtracker.com/rd/r.php?sid=5&pub=4700600060\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Scribd</a> is offering a <a readers to keep them busy while they wait to cast their ballots.</p><p>New users who register by November 3 will have full access to over a million books, podcasts, magazines, and more.</p><p>The company also provides podcast and reading lists curated around how long you can expect to be in your poll line — whether it's<a credit card number when you sign up. Currently, it's only available for new accounts and within the US.</p><h2><strong>How to use your free Scribd membership&#160;</strong></h2><p>Scribd editors curated book and podcast playlists to keep you occupied in your voting line. rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Entertainment While You Wait: 3 Hours and Under</a></li></ul><h2><strong>What to know about Scribd in general</strong></h2><p><a href=\"https://www.scbtracker.com/rd/r.php?sid=5&pub=4700600060\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Scribd</a> is one of our most recommended reading apps. Its selection is varied and full of <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.scribd.com%2Fbestsellerstsellers\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">bestsellers</a>, its price is comparatively low ($9.99/month for unlimited access), and it has useful and intuitive features that allow for offline reading and note-taking. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/scribd-unlimited-subscription-ebooks-audiobooks-review-2018-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">I've personally paid for a membership since 2015</a>. Leighton)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c635a69331a0011bc66fe?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn4@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-07-587_98584ba95a590072.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=uliHTLUK0uM:KjaXDNewiMI:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn55@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-32-759_537ffad822041b3f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=uliHTLUK0uM:KjaXDNewiMI:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn19@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-34-732_c361dde0c6c07325.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=uliHTLUK0uM:KjaXDNewiMI:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn52@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-30-458_1586377d7e16574a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/uliHTLUK0uM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn99@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-31-475_6cfe199de08d7f54.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167086},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How one of the world's biggest STEM programs is still teaching students to build robots during one of the most uncertain school years ever","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/first-robotics-handling-school-year-covid-19-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6a7d0239ab3b001192c77e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FIRST camdenton laser\" height=\"1512\" width=\"2016\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Seniors Maya and Clayton, and junior Nick, students in Camdenton&#39;s R-III school district, work on their robot project in their high school&#39;s workshop.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sherry Comer</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The COVID-19 pandemic has required schools and organizations running extracurricular programs to rethink their approach to education for the 2020-2021 school year.</li>\n<li>FIRST, the global STEM program for elementary, middle, and high school students, has created guidelines for its leagues that schools can follow whether they're holding remote or in-person classes.</li>\n<li>Some aspects of the program are easier to modify than others; students can brainstorm over virtual tools like Zoom, and schools can break up the duties so that children can work on projects individually.</li>\n<li>But the end-of-season competitions will be more difficult to recreate in the era of COVID-19, says Erica Newton Fessia, FIRST's vice president of global field operations.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In Missouri's Camdenton R-III School District, three to five elementary school students would usually share a single robot kit when working on their projects for FIRST.</p><p>FIRST is the global STEM education program designed for elementary, middle, and high schools in which students build robots, program them to complete missions, and showcase their creations in an end-of-season competition. Nearly 700,000 students in about 110 countries participated in its 2019-2020 season. The organization counts industry giants such as 3M, Apple, Google, Ford, Kleiner Perkins, and Qualcomm among its <a href=\"https://www.firstinspires.org/about/our-supporters/founding-and-strategic-sponsors\">strategic partners.</a></p><p>But 2020 isn't like any other school year. Instead, kits in Camdenton are being separated into Rubbermaid containers so that they can be distributed to individual students, allowing them to each work on their own robot rather than sharing parts with their teammates.</p><p>When students are working together in person, they're wearing masks anytime they're in close proximity. Brainstorming sometimes occurs over virtual video chatting platforms.</p><p>Right now, students in the Camdenton district are attending school in person, but Sherry Comer, the after-school services director for the distric, and the rest of the faculty and staff are prepared for that to change at any minute.</p><p>\"It's definitely changed the scope of how we do things on a regular basis,\" Comer said to Business Insider.&#160;</p><p>This is what it's like to run an after-school program in the fall of 2020, when the looming threat of COVID-19 has forced teachers, administrators, and organizations running extracurricular programs like FIRST to rethink their approach to education.&#160;</p><p>For FIRST, which stands for For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology, the key to keeping its 2020-2021 programs going is in providing guidance that schools can follow whether students are in the classroom or in front of a screen at home, since schools' in-person attendance varies by region.&#160;</p><p>The approach that Comer described, dividing the robotics kit among students, is one example of putting these guidelines into practice. FIRST is also moving entirely to remote gameplay for its 2021 FIRST Robotics Competition season, which starts in January.</p><p>\"Each season we give our student participants the challenge to solve a problem with creative solutions and innovation,\" Erica Newton Fessia, vice president of global field operations for FIRST, said in an interview with Business Insider. \"And so we're now doing what we ask our students to do every season.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f6b587939ab3b001192c891?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FIRST camdenton laser 2 (1)\" height=\"2016\" width=\"1512\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Nick, a junior in Camdenton&#39;s school district, works on his robotics project for the FIRST Robotics Competition.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sherry Comer</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The early stages of robotics projects that mostly involve brainstorming and talking through ideas translate well to remote environments, Fessia said, since many students are already used to using video chat platforms for remote learning.&#160;</p><p>Although FIRST is a robotics program and competition, not every aspect of its projects involve programming or building robots. The program also tasks students&#160; with raising funds for their team and coming up with a plan for their project as well as designing and marketing their team brand. And some of those elements are much more suited to remote, virtual collaboration.</p><p>\"In essence, we're really walking them through what it is to be a small robotics startup,\" said Fessia, who was previously director of global philanthropy at Qualcomm before joining FIRST. \"And so they're learning so much more than just how to build a robot.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Scorpius 6 - FLL Team 44266  (@theEclecTechHs) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1261339249640706048?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">May 15, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>It's the hands-on portion of the program that has changed the most, Fessia said. Instead of students coming together as a team to unpack their kits and build robots together, they may be splitting up the work individually, similar to the scenario Comer, in Camdenton, described.</p><p>For example, one solution could involve breaking up challenges — which usually consist of multiple missions that students must program their robots to complete — by distributing specific missions to each student.</p><p>Or students may come together in smaller, socially distanced groups rather than gathering as a whole team, Fessia said.</p><p>In Comer's district, each child works on his or her own robot and then combines all of their work to run all of their missions as one team. Even though the children may be working together differently, Comer says they're still learning the core collaboration and communication skills that will help them in their future careers.</p><p>\"Technical skills are fairly easy to reproduce and teach,\" Comer said. \"But sometimes those skills of just being able to sit down with a group of people, come up with a common goal, and work toward that goal is really hard.\"</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">&#8212;Robo Bears FLL #30898  (@R30898) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1300595519715192833?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 1, 2020</a></blockquote><script async src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#160;</p><p>Another challenge for FIRST will be recreating the usual end-of-season competition in which students get to show off their work. When the end of last season was disrupted because of COVID-19, FIRST created a digital showcase so that students could still demonstrate their robots and share their learnings and discoveries, Fessia said.</p><p>This season, FIRST has pushed the championship back to summer 2021 to allow for more flexibility when scheduling events given the uncertainly caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. FIRST also <a href=\"https://www.firstinspires.org/community/inspire/update-2021-first-robotics-competition-season\">announced last month</a> that this season would include new challenges to the FIRST Robotics Competition that focus on remote learning and building.&#160;</p><p>Although it usually introduces a completely new theme and series of challenges each year, Fessia said that FIRST is using many of the same challenges as it did last year, since the shift to remote learning in March left many US students unable to compete with their robots.</p><p>Despite the disruptions, students still learned to address real-world problems when the coronavirus outbreak suddenly interrupted daily life in March and April. Some students in <a href=\"https://foxsanantonio.com/news/nation-world/camas-high-school-robotics-team-makes-ppe-for-healthcare-workers\">Washington</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whmi.com/news/article/first-howell-brighton-fowlerville-hartland-robotics\">Michigan</a>, for example, pivoted their efforts toward making personal protective equipment for frontline medical workers in the pandemic's early days.&#160;</p><p>The goal of FIRST has always been to prepare students for whatever career path they choose, whether it be in STEM or another field. And that may hold truer than ever during the pandemic.</p><p>\"They're adapting the way they do the work and the way they learn in a way that is going to prepare them for the future,\" Fessia said. \"So in many respects, they're still having that same real world experience that adults are having.\"</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f6b58b039ab3b001192c892?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d216c4b2f533bf29f055b0f400f0e8a7","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-27-263_6359e4432766a9c3.webp","destWidth":1852,"destHeight":1389,"sourceBytes":214888,"destBytes":214888,"author":"leadicicco@businessinsider.com Eadicicco)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f6a7d0239ab3b001192c77e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn59@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-33-438_480be6dd1669d8af.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6b587939ab3b001192c891?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn84@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-32-922_6539888a1c53f7dc.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fiby0eFcQZM:AbXIosFO0zw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn65@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-28-212_2542f01f8b269d51.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fiby0eFcQZM:AbXIosFO0zw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn41@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-35-774_d8920ed2610be29d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=fiby0eFcQZM:AbXIosFO0zw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn6@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-26-093_a0dadc287b173f0e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/fiby0eFcQZM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn36@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-28-581_7f45e577993a5b29.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167095},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How to connect a PS4 controller to your iPhone in 4 simple steps, and play mobile games with a real controller","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-connect-ps4-to-iphone","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c671269331a0011bc6721?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Playstation 4 PS4 controller\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>There are a variety of games you can play when you connect a PS4 controller to your iPhone.\n<p class=\"copyright\">George Dolgikh/Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can connect a PS4 controller to your iPhone through the phone's Bluetooth menu.</li>\n<li>Before you connect it to your iPhone, be sure to put your PS4 controller into pairing mode by holding down the PlayStation and Share buttons.</li>\n<li>Connecting a PS4 controller to your iPhone will let you play a variety of mobile games with a controller.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\" data-uri=\"4c86c1c3a45644bf07d168dc4c802e5e\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>As addicting and fun as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/iphone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">iPhone</a> games are to play, some gameplay mechanics can be tricky to navigate when all you have is a touchscreen. This is especially true for first-person shooters, and other games that require fine movement.</p><p>But there's good news for <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/ps4\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PlayStation 4</a> gamers: You can connect your PS4 controller to your iPhone, and use it to play iPhone games.</p><p>Note that not all games have controller support, and the App Store generally won't tell you which games allow it or not. The only real way to tell is to do research online, or test it yourself.</p><p>You can get started by connecting your PS4 controller through the iPhone's Bluetooth menu.</p><h2><strong>How to connect a PS4 controller to an iPhone</strong></h2><p><strong>1. </strong>On your PS4 controller, press the PlayStation and Share buttons. Hold both down until the backlight light starts flashing, which indicates that your PS4 controller is in pairing mode.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c614e69331a0011bc66ea?format=jpeg\" alt=\"f91041d4 e83a 41ce 861e 4873e0c674e8_3.7fae6f754ce8fd6de13e37dfd6da4056\" height=\"2032\" width=\"2821\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Hold down the PlayStation and Share buttons.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Sony; skitching by William Antonelli</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2. </strong>While your controller is in pairing mode, open your iPhone's Settings app, and select the \"Bluetooth\" tab. Make sure Bluetooth is enabled on your iPhone — if it's not, you can tap the slider at the top of this screen to turn it on.</p><p><strong>3. </strong>Your iPhone will scan for nearby Bluetooth devices. When it finds your controller, you should see its name appear under \"Other Devices\" — if you're using an official PS4 controller, it'll likely be called \"DUALSHOCK 4 Wireless Controller.\" Tap it to connect.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c62d46f5b3100117248d0?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1   How to connect PS4 to iPhone\" height=\"2436\" width=\"1125\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Your controller will appear on your iPhone as “DUALSHOCK 4 Wireless Controller.”\n<p class=\"copyright\">Emma Witman/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4. </strong>Wait a moment. Once the controller successfully connects, the controller will be listed under \"My Devices,\" with the word \"Connected.\"</p><p>Happy gaming! And if you're looking for a new game to tackle with your new controls, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/apple-arcade-launch-best-games-2019-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Apple Arcade has lots of great options</a>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c632b69331a0011bc66fa?format=jpeg\" alt=\"3   How to connect PS4 to iPhone\" height=\"1680\" width=\"1489\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The iPhone game &#34;Life is Strange,&#34; played with a controller.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Emma Witman/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><div src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5d8e19fb2e22af18f40d281d&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><div id=\"ProductCard_5da62c31cc4a0a3f6f6999ae\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe speakers</a></h3></li><li><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/why-wont-my-controller-connect-to-my-ps4\">'Why won't my controller connect to my PS4?': 2 ways to fix a PS4 controller that so that you can buy games for free in </a><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-redeem-code-on-ps4\" data-analytics-position=\"5\" data-analytics-module=\"\">the PlayStation 2020 02:07:00 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c66cf69331a0011bc6720?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"d9036fa2921129a8bf55dc36f8519f62","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn55@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-27-210_49f583685eda805d.webp","destWidth":2666,"destHeight":2000,"sourceBytes":82696,"destBytes":82696,"author":"insider@insider.com (Emma Witman)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c671269331a0011bc6721?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn79@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-29-890_c02f6720f94881bc.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c614e69331a0011bc66ea?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn28@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-33-178_9413eb61bff3fa40.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c62d46f5b3100117248d0?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn32@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-28-590_65cfbd1b72f33f62.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9c632b69331a0011bc66fa?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn19@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-31-614_f8477fc68946893d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=-MLZlxmSwjo:p6W9Enz-cxY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn87@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-34-580_13f1e3c2d4bff4eb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=-MLZlxmSwjo:p6W9Enz-cxY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn79@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-38-125_49a05c6ea4e5991f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=-MLZlxmSwjo:p6W9Enz-cxY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn19@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-33-101_dc716a53752d4622.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/-MLZlxmSwjo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn60@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-28-181_0a424ceef8bcd95c.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167104},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How your drink of choice is linked to who you're voting for in 2020","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/alcohol-drink-preference-voting-2020-election-2020-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c6e9269331a0011bc6764?format=jpeg\" alt=\"white claw voters poll drinking habits 2020 election\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Cartons of White Claw, a flavored alcoholic fizz in a can are on display at the Round The Clock Deli September 11, 2019 in New York City\n<p class=\"copyright\">TIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Images)</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>In a series of polls conducted from August through October, we asked people about their consumption habits in addition to how they plan to vote.</li>\n<li>Respondents who abstain from alcohol are 6 percentage points more likely to vote for President Donald Trump, himself a teetotaler.</li>\n<li>Beer ended up being the most bipartisan drink of choice, with just a 2 percentage point skew toward Democratic nominee Joe Biden.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>In a campaign between two teetotalers, Americans' preference of alcoholic beverages can say something about their choice for president.</p><p>A series of Insider polls conducted from August through October found some political splits in alcohol consumption, as well as among those like Democratic nominee Joe Biden and President Donald Trump who abstain.</p><p>Here's a breakdown of the numbers, which come from an aggregation of nine polls taken between August 8 and October 12. All told, the polls combined to 10,077 respondents, 8,623 of whom indicated they were registered to vote and 8,321 of whom said they would likely do so. Respondents were asked about their intentions of who they would vote for in November as well as a number of other questions.</p><p>This chart shows the difference between the margin of support for Trump or Biden among the given subset of respondents and the overall margin of support among likely voters as a whole:&#160;</p><p>&#160;</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Trump-Biden voter shift based on alcohol preference\" aria-label=\"chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-6jn8O\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/6jn8O/2/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"384\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><ul><li>Non-drinkers are 6 percentage points more likely than the average respondent to say they plan on voting for Trump.</li><li>Beer is the most evenly split beverage of choice, with just a 2 percentage point lean toward Biden.</li><li>Liquor drinkers are the most likely to vote for Biden.</li><li>Wine drinkers are right behind at 8 percentage points more than the average respondent to say they'll back Biden.</li></ul><p>We also polled a bunch of other consumer preferences, including:&#160;</p><ul><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-poll-how-social-media-usage-linked-to-2020-election-2020-10\">Facebook leans red, TikTok trends blue, and YouTube is a swing state: Here's how social media usage is linked to the 2020 election</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-poll-bidens-voters-more-economically-anxious-than-trumps-2020-10\">Insider poll: Biden's voters tend to be more economically anxious than those who back Trump</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-poll-sports-fan-voting-connection-2020-10\">Insider poll: How fans of each major American sports league are likely to vote</a></li></ul><p><em>SurveyMonkey Audience polls from a national sample balanced by census data of age and gender. Respondents are incentivized to complete surveys through charitable contributions. Generally speaking, digital polling tends to skew toward people with access to the internet. SurveyMonkey Audience doesn't try to weight its sample based on race or income. Polling data collected 1,150 respondents August 7,&#160; 1,106 respondents on August 11, 1,128 respondents August 21-22, 1,073 respondents August 29, 1,161 respondents September 4, 1,107 respondents September 15, 1,017 respondents September 18, 1,122 respondents September 28, 1,176 respondents October 5, and 1,130 respondents on October 12. All polls carried approximately a 3 percentage point margin of error individually.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Q3wc4GTiQy0\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Oct 2020 21:58:01 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c6e8a6f5b31001172492e?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"37edab5526a544498837c78e9b0e5ab5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn55@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-26-380_0fa71afc46f65d4d.webp","destWidth":2115,"destHeight":1586,"sourceBytes":515970,"destBytes":515970,"author":"insider@insider.com (Jake Lahut)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c6e9269331a0011bc6764?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn53@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-41-784_8d9fb0bcfaeb7167.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn70@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-35-866_ff9d9c936d421ab9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn55@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-34-215_4deba8c70db2661c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Q3wc4GTiQy0:HLP-q-1MmL8:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn40@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-36-301_f5cd08c61d074f4c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Q3wc4GTiQy0":null},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167083},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"I'm a professional bridesmaid. Here's what happens after the wedding's over, when things can get complicated if the bride wants to stay friends.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/hired-bridesmaid-what-happens-after-wedding-2020-7","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f11a5fd3f7370464b27efa7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"On rare occasions, Jen says she remains good friends with clients. Courtesy of Jen Glantz\" height=\"1067\" width=\"1422\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>On rare occasions, professional bridesmaid Jen Glantz will remain close friends with one of her clients.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jen Glantz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li>Jen Glantz has worked as a professional bridesmaid for six years, participating in the weddings of total strangers and getting paid, sometimes <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/professional-bridesmaid-hired-by-strangers-to-be-their-friend-2020-7\">up to $2,500 per gig</a>.</li><li>Though she's hired to play a bride's pal for the day, she often has to navigate tricky post-wedding expectations that her clients have of their relationship.</li><li>Glantz says some brides don't want to talk to her after the wedding, and some she chooses not to speak to again. But others have become her good friends.</li><li>It's all about chemistry — and when she gets married in 2021, Glantz will invite some of her clients-turned-real-friends to her own wedding.</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li></ul><p>When I first started my business, <a href=\"http://www.bridesmaidforhire.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.bridesmaidforhire.com/&source=gmail&ust=1574192534313000&usg=AFQjCNGaXyGkQLp1p22Cz8N4dGAnk1qv6wN4dGAnk1qv6w\">Bridesmaid for Hire</a>, almost six years ago, I didn't realize what I was truly getting myself into. The business was created after most of my own close friends had gotten married, and I'd became the perpetual bridesmaid, and did my duties well — so well, in fact, that distant friends asked me to take on the role for them, which made me flirt with the question, \"If I can be a great bridesmaid for people I'm hardly friends with anymore, couldn't I get paid to do it for strangers?\"</p><p>Six years later, that idea has flourished as a business and has made me an undercover member of bridal parties all over the country. I've worked with hundreds of clients, seen all kinds of drama, and experienced so many different personality types.</p><p>But the main service I offer, at its core, is supportive friendship to a person getting married. And one of the lessons I've had to learn the hard way in this unique business is what I should do when the wedding ends.</p><h2>How do I let the client know the gig is over and so is our relationship?</h2><p>How do I ask a client to stay friends even after my bridesmaid dress for that wedding is retired? What do I do when a client tells me they don't want to be my friend, but I imagined having a real-life friendship with them?</p><p>Those are the real questions I face on a weekly basis, and have had to find different ways to handle.</p><p>If you've ever wondered how my business works in the sense of staying friends with people after our contract ends, here are the four main scenarios I've come across, and how I've dealt with them.&#160;</p><h2><strong>In some cases, a continued friendship isn't possible</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/57ea81608ceb955c40f3ee03?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jen Glantz\" height=\"800\" width=\"1067\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Glantz has a fake identity at some of the weddings she works, which makes keeping up a real friendship difficult.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Jen Glantz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>One part of my job that makes a post-wedding friendship complicated is that when some clients hire me, I have a fake identity. We decide on a fake name and back story so that nobody in their life (including their fiancé) will know that they hired me. Because of that, seeing them when the wedding ends can be a bit complicated because I'd have to still take on that fake identity.</p><p>Pretending to be someone else is easy at a wedding, because there's a lot going on around you that can serve as easy distractions when people start to make small talk or ask questions. If someone asks me how I know the bride, I share a prepared, one-sentence answer and change the subject to ask if they know if the bar is open yet or if they've tried the shrimp appetizer. In real life, that might be more difficult.</p><p>In those situations, where my identity is fabricated, the person hiring me usually has the expectation that after the wedding, I will disappear and we won't talk again. Rarely, in those cases, will the bride or groom reach out to catch up in the future. But it has happened a few times, and we'll usually just have a quick chat over text.</p><h2><strong>Sometimes, I just don't want to be their friend.&#160;</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f11a5403ad861163c73c459?format=jpeg\" alt=\"At some weddings, Jen is happy to have it be over so she never has to see the person who hired her again. Courtesy of Jen Glantz\" height=\"901\" width=\"1202\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>After some weddings, Glantz feels happy it&#39;s over because she&#39;ll never have to see the bride again.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Jen Glantz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Just like at any job, there are people you work with that you adore, and people you work with that you don't want to be friends with outside of work. Some clients are just not people I'd be friends with in real life, and usually that's because their personality or negative character traits don't align with my personal values.</p><p>When this happens and they do reach out post-wedding, I usually let them know that I'm glad we had the chance to work together, but I'm not interested in continuing the friendship. I keep it professional and am genuinely kind to them during the job and afterward. I just don't accept extended invitations to remain friends when I know that person isn't someone I necessarily want to be around for fun.</p><h2><strong>Most of the time, we stay in touch occasionally</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f11a5773ad861166e70e8f2?format=jpeg\" alt=\"In most cases, Jen stays casual friends with her clients. Courtesy of Jen Glantz\" height=\"1024\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In many cases, Glantz stays casual acquaintances with her clients.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Jen Glantz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>The most common scenario is that when the wedding ends, the person who hired me stays an acquaintance, which means that we catch up occasionally over the phone but don't get together and hang out. Sometimes we do cross paths again and see each other at events around New York City, and we say hello and chat in-person.</p><p>To some people, this part sounds weird because I was hired to be there for them on their big day and am in their wedding pictures. But it's part of the job to leave most of the relationship behind at the wedding. That's why in most cases, I do stay friendly with my clients, but not at a level where we meet up or talk constantly.&#160;</p><h2><strong>Now and then, we stay good friends</strong></h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f11a73f3ad86116b24eae3b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Jen Glantz\" height=\"2448\" width=\"3264\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Some of these working relationships have evolved into hanging out and even spending special occasions together as real friends.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Courtesy of Jen Glantz</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Out of the 50+ clients I work with every year, I stay good friends with around three to four of them. These are the people that when the wedding ends, I'm eager to ask them if they want to hang out afterward. Sometimes I ask and they decline, but occasionally some do say yes and we become good friends. It does get complicated for the brides who hired me under a false identity, and in those cases we usually just hang out one on one. But for the ones who were open and honest about hiring me, our friendship has evolved into nights out and special occasions spent together as real friends.</p><p>I'm planning on getting married in 2021 and will invite some of those people to my own wedding. I'm excited to bring the best part of my job full-circle, and invite those people who were once strangers to join in celebrating my own big day.&#160;</p><section><p><em>Jen Glantz is the founder of the viral business&#160;<a href=\"http://www.bridesmaidforhire.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.bridesmaidforhire.com/&source=gmail&ust=1574192534313000&usg=AFQjCNGaXyGkQLp1p22Cz8N4dGAnk1qv6wN4dGAnk1qv6w\">Bridesmaid for Hire</a>, the creator of the project&#160;<a href=\"http://www.finallythebride.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://www.finallythebride.com/&source=gmail&ust=1574192534313000&usg=AFQjCNEYYrIRHbHbd4f5bqXvIFaTJierbwXvIFaTJierbw\">Finally the Bride</a>, the voice of the podcast \"<a href=\"http://anyyounger.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-saferedirecturl=\"https://www.google.com/url?q=http://anyyounger.com/&source=gmail&ust=1574192534314000&usg=AFQjCNGbjh5hUKRltocqRRFi6etyVtpX2gFi6etyVtpX2g\">You're Not Getting Any Younger,</a>\"&#160;and the author of the Amazon-bestselling books \"<a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/All-My-Friends-are-Engaged-ebook/dp/B0795X9HVX/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=all+my+friends+are+engaged&qid=1582922564&sr=8-1&tag=bisafetynet2-20afetynet2-20\" target=\"_blank\" 2020 01:56:00 href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/as-california-burns-the-winds-arrive-and-the-lights-go-out-2020-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">unprecedented wildfires</a>.&#160;</li><li>As such, nobody would blame you if you're ready to just go hide under a rock for the rest of the year — or stay there in 2021.</li><li>In fact, you can do just that by booking one of these cave rentals or hotels found across the US.</li><li>We found a variety of bookable caves that all come in under $300, with the exception of one splurge-worthy 80,000-square-foot suite.</li><li>Read more: <a Without a doubt, 2020 has been an overwhelmingly stressful news cycle of deadly viruses, police brutality, civil unrest, hurricanes, and wildfires.</p><p>If these have been causing you relentless anxiety, nobody will blame you if you decide to tap out early and find a nice rock to live under for the rest of the year. However, if you decide to take this metaphor up on its offer of cold and solid separation from society, you can at least do it in style and comfort.</p><p>Across the country, there are many unique accommodations made entirely made of stone, built into the side of the wall, or actually located underground for a cave-like experience.</p><p>Some are even quite grandiose like <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/7853734ha?adultsCount=4&petIncluded=truetrue\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Xanadu, a 5,600 square-foot mansion that will cost you $1,200 per night on Vrbo</a>. But if you don't need your cave to have a waterfall flowing through the center of it, there are more affordable rocks you can crawl under too.</p><p>However, even heading underground doesn't put you in a coronavirus-free zone, and you should understand the risks of staying in any hotel or Airbnb. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/is-travel-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">According to experts</a>, vacation rentals such as <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/are-airbnbs-safe-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">private homes found on Airbnb</a> that allow you to keep your distance from fellow guests are the safest way to travel, especially <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/which-is-safer-airbnb-hotels-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">when compared to hotels</a>. If you do choose a hotel, make sure to select one with <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hotel-precautions-coronavirus\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">stringent new policies in place</a>.</p><p>Additionally, without a vaccine, there is no firm guarantee with regard to safety. It's crucial to follow guidelines and advice from organizations such as the CDC and WHO, and practice safety measures including wearing a mask, washing your hands, and maintaining social distancing. Also consider your own level of risk, and whether you're traveling from or to a hotspot, so as not to increase the rate of infection.</p><p>As such, we kept safety top of mind while rounding up our favorite rock-inspired homes and note COVID-19 safety protocols for each listing below.&#160;&#160;</p><p>When choosing cave hotels and rentals, we considered the following criteria:</p><ol><li><strong>While international travel is still on pause with the ongoing pandemic, we kept our search limited to the US.</strong></li><li><strong>Not every accommodation on this list is an actual underground cave, but those that aren't still boast a cave-like experience with stone exteriors and rock-themed interiors.</strong></li><li><strong>Sleeping under a rock is about disconnecting from the rest of the world, not being uncomfortable. Each cave has suitable amenities, beds, and access to a bathroom with running water.</strong></li><li><strong>It takes a lot of labor and calculation to turn a hole in the ground into a livable and structurally-sound environment for guests, which factors into the cost. We considered rentals and rooms within a wide price range between $161 and $950 per night.</strong></li></ol><h2>Here are the best cave rentals and hotels in the US, sorted by price from low to high.</h2>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tHand-carved cave house in Chattanooga, Tennessee, $161\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c1e6b6f5b310011724653?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hand Carved Cave House in Chattanooga, Tennessee, $161\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Vrbo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/971299\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this hand-carved cave house starting at $161 per night on Vrbo</a></h2><p>You don't need to be in an actual cave to technically be under a rock. In fact, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/971299\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">this cave house in Chattanooga, Tennessee</a> is made up entirely of stone and has all the amenities of a modern home.&#160;</p><p>This heated, 700-square-foot cottage keeps up with the cave theme inside too, with a stone wall separating the living area from the bedroom and a carved rock sink in the bathroom. Wide panoramic windows frame a beautiful view of Lookout Mountain.&#160;</p><p>Outside, you can enjoy the amenities of the grill, hot tub, and fire pit while reconvening with nature. Nearby, there are trails for mountain biking, spots for rock climbing, and even caves for exploring if you really want to complete the experience.&#160;</p><p>At the time of writing, there are some dates left in November and December, but the calendar opens up more fully after January.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.vrbo.com/971299\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Vrbo</a> Rating:</strong> 4.9 out of 5</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> More home-like, this is a good option for those who want a taste of cave life without actually venturing underground.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> That said, this will not appeal to those who truly are looking for a more traditional cave.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies: </strong>The listing specifies that you can have a contactless check-in experience and the home will be thoroughly disinfected.</p>\n\tHobbit Cave Suite in Eureka Springs, Arkansas, $169\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c1ebd69331a0011bc6457?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hobbit Cave Suite in Eureka Springs, Arkansas\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Expedia</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=http%3A%2F%2Fexpedia.com%2FEureka-Springs-Hotels-Eureka-Springs-Treehouses.h6608279.Hotel-Information\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this cave suite starting at $169 per night on Expedia</a></h2><p>At <a href=\"https://www.estreehouses.com/eurekaspringshobbit/caves.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Eureka Springs Treehouses, Caves, Castles, &#38; Hobbits</a>, a resort that offers a variety of unique accommodation, you'll find the <a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=http%3A%2F%2Fexpedia.com%2FEureka-Springs-Hotels-Eureka-Springs-Treehouses.h6608279.Hotel-Information\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Hobbit Cave Suite</a> tucked under a grassy hillside. Although it's not technically underground, it certainly achieves a cave aesthetic with floor-to-ceiling stone walls.&#160;</p><p>This romantic abode also features a jacuzzi tub in the stone-laden bathroom, a fireplace, and a beautiful circular-shaped entrance that invokes the hobbit homes of the \"Lord of the Rings\" trilogy. The room has a King-sized bed and boasts bonus amenities like a small kitchenette with a minifridge and coffee maker.</p><p>The property offers three hobbit cave suites located in the grotto, each of which has a private courtyard with chairs and a swing.&#160;</p><p>At the time of writing, there are a few days in December where you can still book one of the three suites, but more availability won't open up until January. There is also a two-night minimum for bookings.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=http%3A%2F%2Fexpedia.com%2FEureka-Springs-Hotels-Eureka-Springs-Treehouses.h6608279.Hotel-Information\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Expedia</a> Rating:</strong> 4.8 out of 5</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> A romantic cave aesthetic with in-room jacuzzi, floor-to-ceiling stone walls, and a cozy feel.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Some guests have complained that the beds are too firm and like, ahem, actually sleeping on a rock.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies: </strong>According to the <a href=\"https://www.estreehouses.com/covid19.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hotel's website</a>, employees' temperatures are checked daily and rooms, including high-touch surfaces, are disinfected with Bioesque Botanical Disinfectant.</p>\n\tBedrock homestead in Boulder, Utah, $325\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c201c6f5b310011724658?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Bedrock Homestead in Boulder, Utah\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F21739874%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067098_IhVe1BOeKdQPr6aL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this bedrock homestead starting at $325 per night on Airbnb</a></h2><p>Not only does <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F21739874%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067098_IhVe1BOeKdQPr6aL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">this cave</a> have a Queen-size bed tucked into a cozy corner and a kitchen with a huge island for entertaining, but it also has a jam room for the musically-inclined and stunning views overlooking the property's orchard and ranch. It's located inside Utahs' Grand Staircase Monument on a 40-acre farm, so you will need to have a car with four-wheel-drive to access it.&#160;</p><p>The home was hand-blasted into the rock by the owner and is powered by a nearby creek using hydroelectricity technology. The cave is technically a shared listing with the host, but guests are assured they'll have a whole separate wing of the home to themselves with a private bathroom and balcony and plenty of privacy. However, in the COVID-era, many may prefer an entirely private option.</p><p>At the time of writing, there are still plenty of dates available in November and December, as well as the first few months of 2021.&#160;</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F21739874%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067098_IhVe1BOeKdQPr6aL\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Airbnb</a> Rating:</strong> 4.9 out of 5</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> A true cave stay that's also remote thanks to being located on a 40-acre farm.&#160;</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Whiles guests have their own separate wing of the house all to themselves, it is attached to where the host stays.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies: </strong>The host does not specify how the home is cleaned, but it has an average 4.9 cleanliness score out of over 200 reviews.</p>\n\tCave on the creek in Sedona, Arizona, $250\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c22616f5b310011724671?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Cave on the Creek in Sedona, Arizona\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F29174900%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067775_mBNqI5ZvuPst6LEl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this creek cave starting at $250 per night on Airbnb</a></h2><p>You can live out your bohemian fantasies in this rock house in Sedona, Arizona, which according to the host was used as a shelter by indigenous Americans over 600 years ago. The cave is well-hidden on the host's property so you will need a guide to show you the way.&#160;</p><p>The cave has two beds, three hammocks, and is decked out with dreamy colorful lights and candles. Beds come with beautiful Native American quilts for keeping cozy.</p><p>However, bear in mind that this is a real cave, so you will be exposed to the elements and may encounter some wildlife. Guests here also have access to a separate room with a bathroom indoors, though this is connected to the host's home.</p><p>At the time of writing, there are still some dates available the first week of November (if you want to miss the election news cycle entirely), but after that, the calendar doesn't open up until March 2021.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F29174900%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067775_mBNqI5ZvuPst6LEl\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Airbnb</a> Rating:</strong> 4.9 out of 5&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> A true cave stay with a Bohemian appeal and plenty of history.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> Guests are exposed to the elements so expect some critters.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies: </strong>New protocols aren't outlined, but out of over 160 reviews, the cave has an average cleanliness score of 4.7.</p>\n\tTwo-bedroom cave house in Leavenworth, Washington, $297\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c23506f5b31001172467b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A Literal Cave in Leavenworth, Washington\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Airbnb</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h2><a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F38439000%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067968_%252FrQey5o0zWC0rRQx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this cave house starting at $297 per night on Airbnb</a></h2><p>Although the entrance to this cave makes it appear quite small, it actually opens up into a massive space with multiple fireplaces and a huge kitchen with a long wooden dining table. Up to eight people can sleep comfortably in <a href=\"https://airbnb.pvxt.net/c/196318/264339/4273?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.airbnb.com%2Frooms%2F38439000%3Fsource_impression_id%3Dp3_1604067968_%252FrQey5o0zWC0rRQx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">this two-bedroom cave house</a> that is fully powered and equipped with running water.&#160;</p><p>Despite being a cave stay, you won't be roughing it. The listing features an all-natural rock hot tub for taking a relaxing soak and even has heated floors in the bathroom. Tall ceilings and light blue walls keep it from feeling too claustrophobic.</p><p>Although it seems that the listing does not have much availability, the host notes in the description that the calendar opens up one day at a time 90 days in advance, so might need to set a calendar reminder to get your desired date.&#160;</p><p><strong><a noopener sponsored\">Airbnb</a> Rating:</strong> 4.9 out of 5</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> This two-bedroom stay comes with luxurious amenities like an all-natural rock hot tub, soaring ceilings, and heated bathroom floors.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> The calendar for booking only opens up 90 days in advance so you have to be vigilent to score a stay.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies: noopener sponsored\">Book Kokopelli's Cave starting at $290 per night on Booking.com</a></h2><p>For a truly immersive cave experience, this <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fkokopelli-39-s-cave.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">bed and breakfast</a> is located 50 feet down, but is actually built into the vertical cliffs of Ojo Alamo Sandstone rather than completely underground. This means you can still enjoy some sunshine from the two porches with sliding glass doors, one off the main entrance, and the other in the bedroom.&#160;</p><p>Inside the cave, you'll find indigenous-inspired art decorating the bedroom and living room and a waterfall shower with a hot tub in the bathroom. In addition to a full kitchen with plenty of counter space, there is also a washer and dryer, which means you can really stay a while. It is a real cave, so guests are warned that they might be visited by cave critters like squirrels and chipmunks.</p><p>Above ground, you'll also be able to enjoy stunning views of La Plata River Valley.&#160;&#160;</p><p>At the time of writing, there are only a couple of days available in November and then <a href=\"https://kokoscave.us/availability/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the calendar</a> doesn't open up until March 2021.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fgrand-canyon-caverns-inn-peach-springs.html%23tab-main\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Book this cavern suite starting at $950 per night on Booking.com</a></h2><p>Two hours from the southern entrance of Grand Canyon National Park, <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fgrand-canyon-caverns-inn-peach-springs.html%23tab-main\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Grand Canyon Caverns Inn</a> may look like an ordinary motel from the street, but 220-feet below ground hides a spacious cavern and hotel suite. And when we say spacious, we mean the cave also happens to be a bomb shelter approved to hold up to 2,000 people.</p><p>At this depth, this is one of the quietest hotel rooms you'll ever sleep in, but also one of the darkest. It's deep enough to deter creatures like mice and bugs who would not survive this far away from the surface. However, with two Queen beds, a record player, television, and a library, humans should survive a few nights in this 80,000-square-foot suite.</p><p>It's definitely pricey, but if you really feel like you need to live under a rock for a while, an elevator that will bring you 22 stories down and closer to the center of the Earth is a good place to start.</p><p>At the time of writing, there are plenty of dates available in November and December 2020 and onward are completely open for booking.</p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fgrand-canyon-caverns-inn-peach-springs.html%23tab-main\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Booking.com</a> Rating:</strong> 7.8 out of 10&#160;</p><p><strong>Pros:</strong> This enormous cave is 80,000 square feet, so you can bring your friends and family to hole up with you.</p><p><strong>Cons:</strong> This stay is much more expensive than many other cave rentals.</p><p><strong>COVID-19 status and policies: </strong>The hotel website doesn't disclose their cleaning protocol, but <a href=\"https://www.awin1.com/cread.php?awinmid=6776&#38;awinaffid=257137&#38;clickref=&#38;ued=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.booking.com%2Fhotel%2Fus%2Fgrand-canyon-caverns-inn-peach-springs.html%23tab-main\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">recent reviews on Booking.com</a> note that the motel rooms were clean.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a alt=\"parachute bed sheets\" height=\"1536\" width=\"2048\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Parachute</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\"><li><strong>You spend one-third of your life in a bed and your quality of sleep affects the quality of the other two-thirds.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Investing in great bedding is a no-brainer in terms of optimization.</strong></li><li><strong>I've covered a lot of bedding companies, but <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Parachute's Percale Venice Sheet Set</a> (Queen, $299) is my choice for day-to-day use thanks to its softness, understated and airy color scheme, and its overall impeccable comfortability.&#160;</strong></li><li><strong>Read more: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-sheets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">The best bed sheets</a></strong></li><li><strong><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-stringify-link=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/insider-picks\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Sign up for Insider Reviews' weekly newsletter for more buying advice and great deals.</a></strong></li></ul><div id=\"ProductCard_5e582b5efee23d28f3141334\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e582b5efee23d28f3141334&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><p>For better or worse, the efficiency of your sleep affects the efficiency and freedom of your waking hours. It bookends the time you spend awake and contextualizes it; good sleep can make it easier to think clearly,&#160;be positive&#160;and productive, and operate at a high level. Bad sleep can impose unnecessary restrictions on your life and daily choices, creating a habit of missed opportunities.&#160;</p><p>I've covered <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/brooklinen-best-sheets-for-winter-twill-bedding-review-2017-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brooklinen</a>, <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/sheex-performance-bed-sheets-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Sheex</a>, <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/loomstead-sheets-recommendation-2017\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Loomstead</a>, and <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/coyuchi-sheets-towels-subscription-recycling-service-2018-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coyuchi</a>, but&#160;<a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Parachute's Percale Venice Sheet Set</a> has surpassed every other brand as my go-to everyday choice for bedding. I'm still loyal to <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/brooklinen-best-sheets-for-winter-twill-bedding-review-2017-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brooklinen's Twill Sheet Set</a> for winter, because who can get past something that literally feels like a worn-in flannel (and you get a bit more mileage out of your money there), but I genuinely <em>enjoy</em>&#160;sleeping on these <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Percale sheets</a> every day. I've even stripped them off in order to try other kinds and felt eager to put them back on again.&#160;</p><h2>Review of Parachute's Venice Percale sheets</h2><p><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Parachute's sheets</a> come in six sizes — Twin, Twin XL, Full, Queen, King, and California King. I tested the <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Venice Percale Set</a> for my Full mattress, which came with&#160;a fitted sheet, duvet cover, and two pillowcases.</p><p>Part of the reason why I tested the <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Venice set</a> is that it includes a duvet cover while other sets didn't and would cost between $130 and $190 to add on. It isn't cheap and some companies, such as <a href=\"http://www.businessinsider.com/brooklinen-bed-sheets-best-purchase-ever-made-kickstarter-2016-5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Brooklinen</a>, give you a top sheet and more pillowcases for about the same price, but Parachute is still my personal pick for comfort and style. Plus, every time you buy a set, <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Parachute</a> donates a life-saving malaria bed net through Nothing But Nets (a United Nations foundation&#160;aimed at ending malaria).</p><p><a href=\"https://go.redirectingat.com/?id=35871X943606&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3F%26opt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-add-1-top-sheet%3Dno-top-sheetheet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5a9db75bed1ed829008b4661?format=jpeg\" alt=\"percale sheet set powder 000_1440x 2\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Parachute</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Parachute sheets</a> come in beautiful colors that make you think of fresh air and watery, springtime sunshine. I tested the <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Percale Venice set</a> in the color Powder and it's the perfect, understated blue that does a great job of mimicking that semi-illusory hue of fresh snow. My room is small but has great light and most of my home goods purchases aim to maximize that. <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Parachute</a>, with its light tones and easy draping, has a light-handed way of making every room look a little more laid-back and sun-drenched. The products are designed in Venice Beach, and their effortless construction is reminiscent of that.</p><p>In terms of feel, the <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Percale</a> was crisp and crinkly like a white button-down. The Percale is best for those who get hot at night since the fabric is lightweight, breathable, and cool to the touch. It's made from 100% long-staple Egyptian cotton.&#160;</p><p>On my bed, it looked clean and comfortable, but it was slightly softer (and perhaps a bit thinner) out of the box than sheets I've tried at a similar price point. This is probably due to the fact that when you come into contact with Parachute bedding, you're interacting with the materials in their natural form, without being treated by toxic materials.</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Parachute</a> is Oeko-Tex Standard 100 certified, which means its products are not made with harmful chemicals and synthetics. Most importantly, it doesn't artificially soften their fabrics. The <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Percale sheets</a>, for instance, are stonewashed for comfort, which uses (you guessed it) large stones to roughen up fabric in order to increase softness and flexibility.&#160;</p><p>This natural take, however, means that their sheets may be more susceptible to chemicals. <a href=\"http://www.pntra.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.parachutehome.com%2Fhow-to-care-for-bedding%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">The company advises</a> you to stay away from harsh liquid and powdered detergents, fabric softeners, dryer sheets, and bleaching agents because they coat and weaken natural fibers. You'll want to keep the bedding away from household cleaners and personal care products that contain benzoyl peroxide or alpha hydroxy acids to prevent any color change. If you have a face or body cream that works on regulating the clarity of your skin, check the ingredients before buying a set.&#160;&#160;</p><p><a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Parachute</a>'s design plan also makes my life a little easier. Pillowcases have an envelope-close so my pillow doesn't slide out of one end during the night, and the duvet covers have a button closure and twill ties in all four corners, plus an added fabric flap to smooth out the texture of the corners. &#160;</p><h2>The bottom line</h2><p>All in all,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Parachute</a>'s quality is pretty stellar across the board. My experience with its <a href=\"https://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fpercale-venice-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite%26opt-size%3Dqueen\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Percale Venice Sheet Set</a> means I'll likely be coming back for a <a href=\"https://www.pntrs.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fsateen-sheet-set%3Fopt-color-sheet%3Dwhite\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">Sateen set</a> in the near future, or to check out the <a href=\"https://www.gopjn.com/t/TUJGRUxJR0JGSEhLR01CRkhKTk1H?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.parachutehome.com%2Fproducts%2Fclassic-bathrobe%3Fopt-color%3Dwhite\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow nofollow sponsored\">bathrobe</a> that has generated <a href=\"https://www.racked.com/2016/11/3/13495284/perfect-cotton-terry-bathrobe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">so much buzz online</a>. If you're looking for a pair of soft, chemical-free sheets that you can feel good about sleeping on, I highly recommend checking out Parachute. And if you don't love them as much as I did, you have 60-days to make up your mind and send them back.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e582b5efee23d28f3141334\" style=\"position:relative; display:block;
