2020 20:55:42 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c76f269331a0011bc67a9?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"143fa09d2641b8795b5e5cc34b514f70","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn100@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-26-997_26ba293b78411fb9.webp","destWidth":1820,"destHeight":1365,"sourceBytes":251616,"destBytes":251616,"author":"insider@insider.com (Mara Leighton)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c770e69331a0011bc67ac?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn16@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-34-731_e1133e72da2f4b8d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5a9db75bed1ed829008b4661?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn16@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-455_7dd86e18198d14d3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DLXX51MHagY:47vAcgr7p-4:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn79@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-28-319_21221ae14d402c3e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DLXX51MHagY:47vAcgr7p-4:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn71@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-32-827_b475de1cf0a5ab9d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=DLXX51MHagY:47vAcgr7p-4:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-38-093_3b2a8c34174580b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/DLXX51MHagY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-28-045_5b4762f4c462ed25.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167091},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"How to add words to the internal dictionary on your Android device, and add shortcuts for longer words","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-add-words-to-android-dictionary","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99c05c69331a0011bc5d4f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"man texting on smart phone\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>It&#39;s easy to add words to your Android&#39;s dictionary.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maskot/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>You can manually add words to your Android device's internal dictionary if it doesn't already recognize them as real words.</li>\n<li>You can also use this feature to create shortcuts for long words that you use frequently, making them quicker to type.</li>\n<li><strong><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\">Visit Business Insider's Tech Reference library for more stories</a>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>It probably comes as no surprise that your phone comes with its own dictionary programmed inside of it — how else would it always know to correct words that you've spelled wrong, or offer you contextual suggestions for what you might say?</p><p>What you may not have known, however, is that you can actually add and remove words from your dictionary on an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/category/android\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Android</a> phone. This is great if you are constantly annoyed by words your phone thinks you're misspelling — for example, if your friend spells their name in an unusual way.</p><p>It's also very useful in that it allows you to create shortcuts for longer words that you use frequently, such as your email address.&#160;</p><h2><strong>How to add words to your Android's internal dictionary</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the Settings app on your Android.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Scroll down until you can tap \"System.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99b80c6f5b310011723f13?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_add_words_to_Android_dictionary_ _1\" height=\"1920\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap &#34;System&#34; in your Android&#39;s Settings app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> From the System menu, go to \"Languages &#38; input.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99b8a069331a0011bc5d05?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_add_words_to_Android_dictionary_ _2\" height=\"1102\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap &#34;Languages &#38; input.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> At the bottom of the menu, tap the arrow next to \"Advanced\" to open the Advanced Settings menu.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99b99869331a0011bc5d0d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_add_words_to_Android_dictionary_ _3\" height=\"1079\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap &#34;Advanced&#34; at the bottom of the menu.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>5.</strong> Under \"Tools,\" tap \"Personal dictionary.\"</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99ba9669331a0011bc5d16?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_add_words_to_Android_dictionary_ _4\" height=\"1732\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap &#34;Personal dictionary.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> To add a word to your personal dictionary when it opens, tap the plus \"+\" button in the upper right corner.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99bb3f69331a0011bc5d21?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_add_words_to_Android_dictionary_ _5\" height=\"1201\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tap the plus &#34;&#43;&#34; icon to add a new word.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7.</strong> Type the new word you want your phone to recognize in the top line provided.</p><p>Optional: Type the shortcut that you want your phone to recognize for this word in the line underneath. When you do this, whenever you type the shortcut and then hit space, it will automatically correct to the longer word.</p><p>When you are finished, tap the back button — the word will automatically save.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f99bbda69331a0011bc5d25?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How_to_add_words_to_Android_dictionary_ _6\" height=\"800\" width=\"1096\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Type the new word in the top line, type a shortcut underneath if you desire, then tap the back button.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Melanie Weir/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>8.</strong> If you ever want to delete a word from your personal dictionary, simply select it from the menu of existing words, then tap the garbage bin icon in the top right corner.</p><div id=\"ProductCard_5e6a7c1f84159f1b1c0bcad4\" style=\"position:relative; display:block; width: 100%\"><iframe src=\"https://produktor.businessinsider.com/productCardService?id=5e6a7c1f84159f1b1c0bcad4&type=small&live=true\" width=\"100%\" height=\"150%\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\" style=\"position:absolute; top:0; left: 0\"></iframe></div><h2><strong>Related coverage from&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" This device will use pulsating lights, extra-loud noises, and a 12-volt bed shaker to make sure they're out the door on time.</p>\n\tPetSafe 5-Meal Pet Feeder\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9d9267eece518a47a9a24?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Pet Safe feeder\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000GEWHNS/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=0d31ca9944f996186f7713d766da1824&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">PetSafe 5-Meal Pet Feeder, available at Amazon, $44.95</a></h3><p>This is a great gift for a pet owner (or for your pet). It's a battery-powered feeder that automatically dispenses up to five pet meals on a schedule that you set. If you're out of the house for a few days, you'll know your pet is taken care of.</p>\n\t8Bitdo SN30 Pro Wireless Bluetooth Controller\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9d9963afd3717141089d6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"8Bitdo\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07BNR6HG9/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=c29baa9307845502daa0bc3bc5029875&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">8Bitdo SN30 Pro Wireless Bluetooth Controller, available at Amazon, $44.99</a> [Save an extra 10% with a coupon]</h3><p>I love 8Bitdo's controllers; no matter how much my \"gamer\" friends mock me, I will never stop using them. They're light and easy to hold, and the buttons are easy for my tiny fingers to maneuver. They make a great, affordable gift for any game-loving friend or relative, but especially those who enjoy retro gaming. While the wireless Sn30 looks old-fashioned, it has all the buttons you need for most modern games, including dual analog sticks.&#160;</p>\n\tEtip Gloves\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9da417eece51af547a5f4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"The North Face E tip gloves\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">The North Face</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://go.skimresources.com?id=35871X943606&#38;xs=1&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thenorthface.com%2Fshop%2Fetip8482-gloves-nf0a3kpn\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Etip Gloves, available at The North Face,&#160;$45</a></h3><p>I'm a big of The North Face's eTip gloves, which are more expensive and higher quality than the Digits gloves I mentioned earlier in this guide. Not only are they made of grippy and fully conductive material, but they're super stretchy and come in a variety of fun designs.&#160;</p>\n\tJBL Clip 3\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5de92bf5fd9db24b3b4683f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"JBL Clip 3\" height=\"520\" width=\"693\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Verizon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://bestbuy.7tiv.net/c/196318/614286/10014?subId1=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bestbuy.com%2Fsite%2Fjbl-clip-3-portable-bluetooth-speaker-black%2F6213287.p%3FskuId%3D6213287\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow\">JBL Clip 3 Waterproof Portable Bluetooth Speaker, available at Best Buy, $39.99</a></h3><p>This tiny portable Bluetooth speaker will allow your friend or relative to take their tunes on the go. It's waterproof, so you can bring it to the beach or out in the rain, and plays up to 10 hours on a charge. You can also use it to make calls, with the help of its noise-cancelling speaker technology.</p>\n\tPetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Water Fountain\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9db537eece51ce2140819?format=jpeg\" alt=\"PetSafe drinking fountain\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">PetSafe</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000L3XYZ4/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=41786968d22b3fd075c748ef57a50b1d&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Water Fountain, available at Amazon, $44.95</a></h3><p>Here's another one for pets &#8212; specifically, cats. It's a mini fountain that constantly filters and dispenses clean running water. It'll ensure that your cat has access to a fresh drink at all times, even when you're not home to refill their bowl.&#160;</p>\n\tAudio-Technica ATH-M20x Professional Studio Monitor Headphones\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9de477eece521ca03fedb?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Audio Technicia headphones\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00HVLUR18/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=99a587cd64ac1f4e607feed2b0b85267&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Professional Studio Monitor Headphones, available at Amazon, $49.00</a></h3><p>These are <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-cheap-headphones#the-best-cheap-headphones-overall-1\">our reviewers' favorite cheap headphones</a> for their excellent sound quality, comfortable design, and effective noise-isolation. Note that as studio headphones, these are best suited for use with a computer, TV, or home-entertainment system, rather than a smartphone. They're attached to a sturdy 3.5mm cable, and come with a 6.3mm adapter for larger audio equipment.&#160;</p>\n\tGoogle Home Mini\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ef4ec16988ee32623363835?format=jpeg\" alt=\"google nest mini 2\" height=\"844\" width=\"1125\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Christian de Looper/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&#38;sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FGoogle-Nest-Mini-2nd-Generation-Chalk%2F751612012\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Google Nest Mini, available at Walmart, $29.00</a></h3><p>A Google Nest Mini is a great gift for a friend looking to get started on a smart home, or anyone who just wants a nice smart speaker. It sounds decent for its small size, and it's got a very cute futuristic design for a modern home. If your friend hasn't used a voice AI before, they'll love playing around with Google Assistant and discovering everything it can do.&#160;</p>\n\tCorsair K55 RGB Gaming Keyboard\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9df313afd3720153cfe32?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Corsair keyboard\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01M4LIKLI/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=96337462930ea94011847c25e47a48d7&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Corsair K55 RGB Gaming Keyboard, available at Amazon, $49.88</a></h3><p>Any gamer or aspiring-gamer friends will appreciate the gift of a good gaming keyboard. It also has six programmable buttons which they can customize to their gaming style. Though the K55 is only $49, it has the look and feel of a much more expensive RGB device.</p>\n\tLectroFan White Noise Machine\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9dfe37eece524800694d3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"LectroFan \" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/LectroFan-Fidelity-Machine-Unique-Non-Looping/dp/B00JU8P8VY/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=34fc5e01690ad9b84243bbaacf705c22&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">LectroFan White Noise Machine, available at Amazon, $45.96</a></h3><p>If you have a friend or relative who has trouble sleeping, you need to buy them this white noise machine, which plays ten different types of fan sounds. You might be skeptical, but trust me: The LectroFan's fan sounds are actually the most calming ambient noise I have ever heard. (For more traditional users, it plays 10 levels of white noise as well). I gave this device to an insomniac friend this summer, and he still uses it every night.</p>\n\tAmazon Echo Dot\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f92dfcc212113001874065d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon Echo Dot 2020\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07XJ8C8F5/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B07XJ8C8F5&#38;linkId=6ebb3e93dea384bc89391e1756414185\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Echo Dot, available at Amazon, $49.99</a></h3><p>Don't let the price fool you: The Echo Dot is a great gift not just because it has Amazon Alexa built in, but also because for such a small speaker, it sounds incredible. You can also ask Alexa to adjust the equalizer settings on the Dot (for example, \"Alexa, turn up the bass\").&#160;</p><p>Like the Google Nest Mini, this gift is a great way to introduce a friend to smart home and voice assistants. I gave this to a friend last year, and he spent four hours playing with it when he got home. The new fourth-generation model features an updated spherical design, but the puck-shaped <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07FZ8S74R/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=2785c71d1bd6e6714a4aaff03e3c983b&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">third-generation version</a> is still available if you're looking for an even more affordable gift option.&#160;</p>\n\tLogitech Z313 Speaker System\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9e0957eece525d41251f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Logitech speakers\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-980-000382-Z313-Speaker-System/dp/B002HWRZ2K?tag=biipgf_021219_best-computer-speakers-20\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Logitech Z313 Speaker System, available at Amazon, $39.88</a></h3><p>For any friend who is looking to replace their computer speakers (or buy their first set), Logitech's Z313 is the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-computer-speakers#the-best-budget-computer-speakers-2\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">best budget option</a>. This model also steps things up from HD to 4K streaming support. The included remote has dedicated buttons for a few popular streaming apps, along with a microphone for voice search.</p><p>&#160;</p>\n\tSatechi 7-Port USB Charging Station Dock\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5dc9e1997eece527971d55c8?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Satechi charger\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Satechi</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00TT9O0SG/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_110819_tech-gifts-under-50-20&#38;linkId=b8290c58854b89d166ccd1769550f10e&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Satechi 7-Port USB Charging Station Dock, available at Amazon, $49.99</a></h3><p>Gift this device to any tech enthusiast, and they'll wonder where it's been their whole life. eece503d614f944?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-29-170_593995e7e177010d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9cc227eece5048d771ea3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn76@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-27-245_35be7d652f7552d5.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9cc8b7eece505343a9f97?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn27@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-31-736_22ae8aa766705aec.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9cd823afd3703866bbc17?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn53@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-28-122_224ce1a9503fa365.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9cdf33afd37044465e4f8?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn44@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-34-141_d18055135e4112a8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5e7b888bba85ee08302f8b52?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn83@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-28-387_9b2b1d123d27d23a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f6e222c0f4d5500110325cd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn46@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-35-776_be693be1220e18ec.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9cfe33afd3706e5398e35?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn40@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-34-101_8e4d4b2b269d826d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9d0bc3afd3707c5062633?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn39@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-31-121_d0a4de4e91b2f34d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9d1b87eece50c0e7b8a54?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn55@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-28-820_05455dc2a715d72d.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9d2243afd3709ac42ccb2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn83@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-38-120_451b4fc8e0df546f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9d2cd7eece50da26fded4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn52@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-27-205_88524c985e77b737.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9d60a3afd37107b3cdc64?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/ 79f0ca8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9e0957eece525d41251f3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn75@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-28-312_9bcc14146aa1a23a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f9b10006f5b310011724448?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/31/07-26-28-667_d28c7511a67475e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9e1997eece527971d55c8?format=jpeg":null,"https://i.insider.com/5e21ed3db6d52d5f7844b50a?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn35@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-28-064_e2194010621575c8.webp","https://i.insider.com/5dc9e2c13afd3725f011dd03?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-30-835_f1061aed577856e8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vNRGX8SgA7k:fA0IgW4ZK5Y:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn95@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-29-290_d41f32a3e3a34c1d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vNRGX8SgA7k:fA0IgW4ZK5Y:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn15@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-38-421_d9afb08e5a1ee66d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vNRGX8SgA7k:fA0IgW4ZK5Y:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn59@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-094_e7909f078c2fa5ca.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/vNRGX8SgA7k":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn77@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-790_8faa2b58d8f383b5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167136},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"The CDC will let cruises sail again starting November 1, but normal trips are likely a long way away","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/cdc-lifts-cruising-no-sail-order-november-issues-conditions-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ed78ace3f737066450034b3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"ROTTERDAM, NETHERLANDS - 2020/05/06: People waiting for relatives on board as the ship docks. Cruise ship Regal Princess has docked in Rotterdam with about nine hundred Europeans, at least ten are Dutch. The ship returns crew members from other cruise ships to Europe. As far as it is known, no one is infected with the corona virus. (Photo by Robin Utrecht/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images)\" height=\"3334\" width=\"5000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The CDC gave the cruise industry a path toward restarting trips in a detailed set of guidelines it released Friday.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Robin Utrecht/SOPA Images/LightRocket via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention gave cruise lines a path toward restarting US operations Friday.&#160;</li>\n<li>Under the CDC's new order, cruise lines will be able to sail again on November 1, but they won't be allowed to bring passengers on board until they meet a rigorous set of requirements.&#160;</li>\n<li>The CDC pushed to extend its no-sail order to February 2021, but the White House intervened to overrule that plan, <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/scoop-white-house-overruled-cdc-cruise-ships-florida-91442136-1b8e-442e-a2a1-0b24e9a39fb6.html\">Axios reported</a>.&#160;</li>\n<li>The current no-sail order expires October 31.&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention will let US cruises sail again starting November 1, but companies will need to meet a long list of requirements before they can let passengers back on board, the agency <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2020/s1030-safe-responsible-ship-passenger-operations.html\">announced</a> Friday.&#160;</p><p>The CDC will let its latest no-sail order expire at the end of October, lifting the ban on cruising that it put in place as the pandemic hit the US in March. The agency had pushed to extend the order until February, but the White House — under pressure from Florida lawmakers and industry lobbyists — overruled that plan in favor of an October 31 expiration, <a href=\"https://www.axios.com/scoop-white-house-overruled-cdc-cruise-ships-florida-91442136-1b8e-442e-a2a1-0b24e9a39fb6.html\">Axios reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>Now cruises will be able to hit US waters once again just days before the presidential election, but it appears that travelers won't be able to board the ships anytime soon. The CDC's \"Framework for Conditional Sailing Order\" — which replaces the previous no-sail order — \"introduces a phased approach for the safe and responsible resumption of passenger cruises.\"&#160;The CDC's goal is to prevent the kinds of severe COVID-19 outbreaks that rocked cruise ships in the early days of the pandemic.</p><p>In the first phases, cruise operators will need to \"demonstrate adherence to testing, quarantine and isolation, and social distancing requirements to protect crew members\" as they develop the capacity to test crew and passengers.</p><p><em><strong>Read more</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/carnival-coronavirus-covid-19-diamond-grand-princess-zaandam-2020-7?r=tl-sub\">Shipwrecked: How Carnival's high hopes for 2020 gave way to 'floating petri dishes,' stranded crew members, and a spate of COVID-19 deaths at sea</a></em></p><p>Later phases will involve mock voyages with volunteers playing the role of passengers. Cruise lines that prove their ability to mitigate COVID-19 risks adequately will be certified to bring back passengers.</p><p>During the initial phases, the CDC plans to help cruise lines protect crew members by creating a laboratory team to oversee coronavirus testing.&#160;</p><p>\"This framework provides a pathway to resume safe and responsible sailing. It will mitigate the risk of COVID-19 outbreaks on ships and prevent passengers and crew from seeding outbreaks at ports and in the communities where they live,\" said CDC Director Robert R. Redfield, M.D. in a statement.&#160;</p><p>The conditional sailing order provides a light at the end of the tunnel for the struggling cruise industry, which the COVID-19 pandemic brought to an abrupt standstill when it hit the US earlier this year. Carnival Corporation, the world's largest cruise operator, reported a $2.9 billion net loss for the third quarter of 2020 and recently announced plans to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/carnival-selling-18-ships-amid-billions-losses-no-sail-order-2020-9\">sell 18 ships</a>, or about 12% of its fleet.&#160;&#160;</p><div href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=sUIVCYnDoiw:JHpbgbKnLKc:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sUIVCYnDoiw:JHpbgbKnLKc:V_sGLiPBpWU\" src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sUIVCYnDoiw:JHpbgbKnLKc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/sUIVCYnDoiw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Oct 2020 20:31:28 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f9c71ae6f5b310011724947?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"65948dbfdcbbc8dba2acf79c3af6fecb","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn83@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-25-959_7c49f2fcea27434c.webp","destWidth":2714,"destHeight":2035,"sourceBytes":675402,"destBytes":675402,"author":"tlevin@businessinsider.com (Tim Levin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5ed78ace3f737066450034b3?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn92@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-38-270_85fd2ce6a827082b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sUIVCYnDoiw:JHpbgbKnLKc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn64@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-41-035_1a2af72208b1c2f2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sUIVCYnDoiw:JHpbgbKnLKc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn44@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-30-414_b944e7c6adda1849.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=sUIVCYnDoiw:JHpbgbKnLKc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn91@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-29-378_2a2e6f55a16363e9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/sUIVCYnDoiw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/31/07-26-36-386_74958017e58886d8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167089},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"A corporate bond provides companies with cash and investors with income — here's how to evaluate the risks and rewards","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-a-corporate-bond","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c50ca6f5b31001172482b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"corporate bond\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Corporate bonds generally pay a better interest rate than government bonds.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tapanakorn Katvong / EyeEm/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A corporate bond is issued by a company to raise money; like any debt, it pays investors regular interest and a return of their principal when it matures.</li>\n<li>Corporate bonds are ranked for quality and risk by credit rating agencies, based on the financial soundness of their issuing company.</li>\n<li>Higher-rated, \"investment grade\" corporate bonds consistently pay a higher interest rate than US Treasuries, at relatively little risk.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\"><strong>Visit Insider's Investing Reference library for more stories</strong></a><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\" data-analytics-module=\"summary_bullets\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"0\"><strong>.</strong></a></li>\n</ul><p>Just like people, businesses often need to borrow money — to finance new ventures, pay off old debts, or even to buy another firm. One method at their disposal is to issue bonds.</p><p>A corporate bond, like any bond, is basically a type of debt. The purchaser of a corporate bond effectively lends cash to the issuing company. In exchange, the company becomes obligated to pay interest on this principal sum and to return it in full after a set period,&#160; when the bond matures.</p><p>For investors, corporate bonds offer a source of income — one that's more reliable than stock dividends, since the interest payments are usually fixed, and more lucrative than ultra-safe-but stolid US Treasury bonds. Of course, in the investment world, there's always a tradeoff between risk and reward. And the reliability of corporate bonds can vary, depending on the company issuing them.</p><h2>What is a corporate bond?</h2><p>The main purpose of corporate bonds is to help companies raise additional cash, without having to borrow from a bank, sell equity — that is, issue more stock shares —&#160; or seek out venture capitalists.&#160;</p><p>\"Companies issue bonds to raise cash to bolster their balance sheets or re-invest in a particular project or expansion plan, \" says Susannah Streeter, a senior investment and markets analyst at <a href=\"https://www.hl.co.uk/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hargreaves Lansdow</a>. \"Investors who buy corporate bonds are lending money to the company, in the same way as investors who buy government bonds like US Treasuries or UK Gilts are lending money to governments to finance public spending.\"</p><p>Bondholders are entitled to two sources of income:</p><ul><li>The regular interest installments, usually paid annually or semi-annually. Most bonds pay a fixed interest rate, but variable-rate, or floating, bonds exist too. These are usually based on a benchmark, such as a bond index or prevailing Treasury rate.</li><li>A full repayment of the principal after the bond's term ends. Corporate bonds generally have maturities from three years to 10, though they can be shorter or longer.</li></ul><p>After they're issued, corporate bonds trade on stock exchanges, in the secondary <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/bonds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">bond markets</a>. Investors can always choose to sell a bond at market price before it matures. This move may be profitable if interest rates, in general, have declined since the bond was issued: A fall in interest rates sparks a rise in bond prices — because that bond is paying a now higher-that-average rate.</p><h2>How are corporate bonds evaluated?</h2><p>In terms of risk, corporate bonds are not all created equal. Much depends on the company issuing them — specifically, on its creditworthiness (the soundness of its finances and ability to pay its debts). This is expressed by its credit rating, something akin to an individual's credit score.</p><p>Corporate credit ratings are provided by the three major credit rating agencies: Moody's, Fitch, and S&#38;P. The rating systems used by these independent firms differ from each other slightly, but they all use letter grades:</p><ul><li>A ratings are assigned to companies deemed to be subject to the lowest level of credit risk</li><li>B ratings usually indicate some moderate credit risk</li><li>C ratings indicate very high credit risk</li><li>D ratings are reserved for companies in default, or bankrupt</li></ul><p>Any bond rated BBB (for Fitch and S&#38;P) or Baa (for Moody's) or above is considered \"investment-grade,\" which — as the name implies — indicates the most suitable choice for investors.&#160;</p><p>In contrast, any corporate bond with a rating below BBB (for Fitch and S&#38;P) or Baa (for Moody's) is classified as \"non-investment grade.\" This doesn't mean they're off-limits to investors, just that they're higher-risk — and so they pay higher interest. Officially, they're called \"high-yield bonds\" — or, more colloquially, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-are-junk-bonds?r=US&IR=TIR=T\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">junk bonds</a>.&#160;</p><h2>Why invest in a corporate bond?</h2><p>Corporate bonds have a variety of advantages, including:</p><h3>They're a good source of income</h3><p>&#160;\"Corporate bonds traditionally offer very attractive yields because they carry more credit risk than government bonds,\" says Edward Moya, a market analyst with New-York based forex broker OANDA.</p><p>But then, just about everything does, since government bonds are considered virtually risk-free. \"Corporate bonds which have attracted a high-quality rating are viewed as a relatively safe investment,\" says Susannah Streeter.</p><p>While average yields will vary according to the economic cycle, investment-grade corporate bonds usually offer rates that are two to three percentage points higher than <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-buy-treasury-bonds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">US Treasury bonds</a>. For example, Intel and Coca-Cola — two companies with an A1 rating — are paying a 4% and 3.25% rate on bonds that mature in 2022 and 2024, respectively.</p><p>The difference <a href=\"https://www.frbsf.org/education/publications/doctor-econ/2004/january/corporate-treasury-bonds-interest-rates-risk-spreads/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tends to grow during downturns and shrink during expansions</a>&#160;when Treasuries have to offer higher rates to attract buyers.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Corporate bonds move in tandem with government bonds, but consistently pay higher interest\" aria-label=\"Interactive line chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-kfSVT\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/kfSVT/2/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"400\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><h3>They diversify your portfolio</h3><p>Corporate bonds can help investors diversify their holdings. Debt instruments like bonds often act as a counterbalance to equities, moving opposite to stocks.</p><p>\"Many investors want to build a balanced portfolio. Including bonds can offset the higher risk of buying shares in companies with ambitious growth strategies,\" Streeter says.</p><h3>They can offer capital gains</h3><p>While corporate bonds are basically an<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investment-income-assets\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"> income investment</a>, it's still possible for investors to speculate with them. Given that bond prices can fluctuate depending on the interest rates and economic conditions, corporate bonds can present opportunities for profit during volatile periods.</p><p>This is particularly true of junk bonds, which <a href=\"https://www.alliancebernstein.com/abcom/perspectives_web/market/retail/equity-like-returns/equity-like-returns-whitepaper.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">have historically behaved more like equities than low-risk corporate bonds</a>. The correlation between junk bonds and equities even increased since the onset of the coronavirus pandemic, buoyed by <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/federal-reserve-emergency-corporate-bond-etf-purchases-coronavirus-policy-economy-2020-5-1029191923?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest#est#\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">the Federal Reserve's commitment to buy corporate bonds</a>.</p><p>Of course, you have to time the selling of your bonds carefully and be ready to move fast when prices rise.</p><h2>Risks associated with corporate bonds</h2><p>Where there's reward, there's also risk, and corporate bonds are no exception.&#160;</p><h3>Credit risk: The company could default</h3><p>Credit or default risk relates to the possibility that a company may get into financial straits, impairing its ability to make its interest payments — and even the principal on its bond. \"Should a company go bust, bond investors may lose money,\" says Streeter. \"However, even bankrupt firms must pay creditors, including bondholders first, before reimbursing investors who hold the company's shares,\" she adds.</p><h3>Call risk: You could lose the bond</h3><p>Some corporate bonds include a call provision, which provides the company with the ability to repurchase, or \"call,\" the bonds at face value before maturity. This is particularly risky for investors in situations where interest rates have fallen and market prices for bonds have risen since it would deprive them of the ability to make a profit from selling their bonds on the open market. And of course, you lose the interest from the bond, and may not be able to find another with an equally good rate.</p><h3>Liquidity risk: You could find it hard to sell</h3><p>The bond market has historically lacked the pricing transparency of the stock market. This is more of a problem for bonds issued by private companies or smaller firms that trade over the counter. Investment-grade bonds issued by bigger companies are less likely to run into this issue.</p><h3>Interest/inflation risk: The bond loses value</h3><p>This is a systematic risk that's faced by every fixed-interest bond: Potential interest rate rises will cause the market value of bonds to fall. There's also the problem of inflation, which could erode the value of interest payments and the face value of a bond reaching maturity.&#160;</p><p>Generally, the longer the bond's maturity, the greater its vulnerability to these risks; that's why longer-term bonds pay a bigger interest rate.</p><h2>How to buy corporate bonds</h2><p>There are two ways to buy corporate bonds.</p><ul><li><strong>Individual bonds: </strong>Corporate bonds are issued and sold in blocks of $1,000. Individual investors can buy them through Investment platforms, brokers, and financial services companies such as Fidelity, Vanguard, and E*TRADE, which charge fees of anything from $1 to $2 per bond. Banks such as Wells Fargo and Morgan Stanley also let you buy individual bonds, although these generally charge higher fees.</li><li><strong>Bond funds:</strong> \"Most investors buy a corporate bond fund, as this spreads risk and allows lower investment entry amounts,\" says Susannah Streeter. Bond funds can be either mutual funds, like the Payden Corporate Bond Fund (<a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/funds/payden-corporate-bond-fund-us7043293668\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">PYACX</a>), or exchange-traded funds (ETFs), like the iShares iBoxx $ Investment Grade Corp Bond ETF (<a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/etfs/ishares-iboxx-investment-grade-corporate-bond-etf-us4642872422\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">LQD</a>).</li></ul><h2>The financial takeaway</h2><p>The main attraction of corporate bonds is that they offer a safe income stream, assuming that the companies issuing them have high credit ratings. Corporate bonds offer higher returns than you'll likely find with government bonds.&#160;</p><p>They can be also used by less risk-averse investors to speculate, with falls in interest rates tending to increase bond prices. Such strategies come with a number of dangers, chief amongst them being the risk that interest rate rises will depress bond prices.&#160;</p><p>There's also the omnipresent risk of default, which would deprive bondholders of interest payments and potentially their entire investment.</p><p>These caveats aside, corporate bonds (and bond funds) can serve as key elements in a diversified portfolio — provided you know which ones to pick.</p><h2>Related Coverage in&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/investing-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">Investing</a>:</h2><h3><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/corporate-bond-sales-reach-trillion-fastest-pace-ever-debt-market-2020-5-1029258342\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">US corporate bond sales surge past the $1 trillion threshold at the fastest pace ever</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/federal-reserve-corporate-debt-index-top-beneficiaries-purchases-companies-bonds-2020-6-1029351621#\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Here are the 10 companies set to benefit the most from the Fed's debt purchases</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/bonds-vs-cds\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"8\" data-analytics-module=\"\">Bonds vs. CDs: The key differences and how to decide which income-producing option is better for you</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-an-etn\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"15\" data-analytics-module=\"\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"100\">ETNs combine a bond's reliability with a stock's profitability. Here's how they work, and how to weigh the risks and rewards</a></h3><h3><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/what-is-an-index-fund\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-position=\"1\" data-analytics-module=\"featured_post\">What is an index fund? 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Insider poll: Your travel history is linked to who you're voting for in 2020","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-poll-travel-history-linked-to-who-youre-voting-for-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c724469331a0011bc6781?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GettyImages travelers airport\" height=\"652\" width=\"1024\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Passengers wait to board a flight at the Long Beach Airport in Long Beach on September 17, 2020.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Brittany Murray/MediaNews Group/Long Beach Press-Telegram via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>&#160;Whether Americans travel &#8212; or not &#8212; is linked to the 2020 presidential candidate they're voting for, according to a series of polls.</li>\n<li>Voters who have been around the United States and outside the country tended to favor former Vice President Joe Biden over President Donald Trump.</li>\n<li>The surveys were conducted by Insider with SurveyMonkey from August to October.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Whether Americans have lived in more than one state, been outside the country, or not traveled much is linked to who they're voting for in the 2020 presidential election, according to a new series of polls.</p><p>The surveys, conducted by Insider with SurveyMonkey, show that people who have a travel history tend to favor former Vice President Joe Biden over President Donald Trump.</p><p>This chart shows the difference between the margin of support for Trump or Biden among the given subset of respondents and the overall margin of support among likely voters as a whole:</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><iframe title=\"Trump-Biden voter shift based on travel history\" aria-label=\"chart\" id=\"datawrapper-chart-g9luF\" src=\"https://datawrapper.dwcdn.net/g9luF/3/\" scrolling=\"no\" frameborder=\"0\" style=\"width: 0; min-width: 100% ; border: none;\" height=\"383\"></iframe><script type=\"text/javascript\">!function(){\"use strict\";window.addEventListener(\"message\",(function(a){if(void 0!==a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"])for(var e in a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"]){var t=document.getElementById(\"datawrapper-chart-\"+e)||document.querySelector(\"iframe[src*='\"+e+\"']\");t&&(t.style.height=a.data[\"datawrapper-height\"][e]+\"px\")}}))}();</script></div><p>This breakdown comes from an aggregation of nine polls taken between August 8 and October 12. All told, the polls combined to 10,077 respondents, 8,623 of whom indicated they were registered to vote and 8,321 of whom said they would likely do so. Respondents were asked about who they intended to vote for in November as well as a number of other questions.</p><p>The data offers a glimpse into voter backgrounds as the 2020 race reaches its final stretch, with just four days left until Election Day.&#160;&#160;</p><ul><li>More than half of the respondents who said they visited another country preferred the Democratic presidential nominee by 9 percentage points.</li><li>Similarly, those who have traveled outside of North America were 13 percentage points likelier to vote for Biden.</li><li>Voters who have lived in different states for a long period of time, who made up 23% of respondents, also leaned toward Biden by 12 percentage points.</li></ul><p><em>SurveyMonkey Audience polls from a national sample balanced by census data of age and gender. Respondents are incentivized to complete surveys through charitable contributions. Generally speaking, digital polling tends to skew toward people with access to the internet. SurveyMonkey Audience doesn't try to weight its sample based on race or income. Polling data collected 1,150 respondents August 7,&#160; 1,106 respondents on August 11, 1,128 respondents August 21-22, 1,073 respondents August 29, 1,161 respondents September 4, 1,107 respondents September 15, 1,017 respondents September 18, 1,122 respondents September 28, 1,176 respondents October 5, and 1,130 respondents on October 12. All polls carried approximately a 3 percentage point margin of error individually.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (Oma Seddiq)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5f9c724469331a0011bc6781?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn32@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-30-354_3d493ab0a67e057f.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn81@2020_6/2020/10/31/07-26-35-995_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=U0TR0PJJYU0:yve2v6eD29M:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn75@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-29-847_79a60c0282119e5e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=U0TR0PJJYU0:yve2v6eD29M:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn47@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-36-299_7fb306f7e6e95588.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn84@2020_1/2020/10/31/07-26-32-089_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=U0TR0PJJYU0:yve2v6eD29M:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn99@2020_4/2020/10/31/07-26-33-070_e2f5a2f763941764.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/U0TR0PJJYU0":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn20@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-33-790_f785da724b891878.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1604129167078},{"createdTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","updatedTime":"2020-10-31 15:26:07","title":"Amazon appears to have donated $40,000 to a top source of vaccine misinformation, according to a screenshot posted by a volunteer for the group","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-reportedly-donated-40000-to-top-vaccine-misinformation-source-2020-10","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f76394474fe5b0018a8e95c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon\" height=\"2000\" width=\"2666\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Pascal Rossignol/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Amazon contributes money to the National Vaccine Information Center (NVIC), a top source of vaccine misinformation in the US, through its AmazonSmile program.&#160;</li>\n<li>The company appears to have given more than $40,000 to the group, <a href=\"https://popular.info/p/amazon-donated-40000-to-the-nations\">Popular Information reported.&#160;</a></li>\n<li>The NVIC is \"one of the most prominent organizations that has been against vaccines of any kind,\" K. \"Vish\" Viswanath, a professor of health communication at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, told Insider, adding that Amazon's funding of NVIT is \"shocking.\"&#160;</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Amazon appears to have donated $40,000 in funds to a major source of vaccine misinformation, according to a report from Popular Information.&#160;</p><p>The <a href=\"https://popular.info/p/amazon-donated-40000-to-the-nations?token=eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjoyMjk4NDM0LCJwb3N0X2lkIjoxNTQwMzE1MiwiXyI6IlFRem5rIiwiaWF0IjoxNjAzOTY4NjY5LCJleHAiOjE2MDM5NzIyNjksImlzcyI6InB1Yi0xNjY0Iiwic3ViIjoicG9zdC1yZWFjdGlvbiJ9.pWW47hC3bIOQcISTP6RFYsHYkYApDPU-CeslTEfUaCc\">Popular Information newsletter</a>, founded by journalist Judd Legum, reported on Thursday that Amazon has been funneling funds to the National Vaccine Information Center (NVIC).&#160;</p><p>Through <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-does-amazon-smile-charity-donation-work-2018-5#:~:text=AmazonSmile%20is%20a%20program%20that,one%20million%20public%20charitable%20organizations.\">AmazonSmile</a>, Amazon donates .5% of eligible purchase profits to the charity an individual user has chosen to support. NVIC is one such organization that the company allows users to contribute to.</p><p>AmazonSmile donation records are not publicly available, but Insider confirmed on Amazon's website that users are able to choose the NVIC as their AmazonSmile charity of choice. More than one million 501(c)(3) tax-exempt non-profits are available for donations on AmazonSmile.&#160;</p><p>Popular Information's reporting was based on a screenshot of Amazon donation records shared on an anti-vaxx message board by a NVIC volunteer. The outlet obtained the screenshot —&#160; which the volunteer said showed the AmazonSmile donation records to his organization — from a closed message board called VaxCalc Forum.</p><p>According to that screenshot, posted by NVIC volunteer Chris Downey in September, AmazonSmile had given the group $41,533.71 to date. Downey did not immediately respond for comment.</p><p>Insider was unable to independently obtain a copy of the image showing donation records, as users need to be approved by the anti-vaxx forum in order to view the conversations.&#160;</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c6fbc6f5b31001172493d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020 10 30 at 3.54.05 PM\" height=\"327\" width=\"423\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Amazon allows users to donate a portion of their purchases to the National Vaccine Information Center, a top source of vaccine misinformation in the US.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Screenshot/Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The NVIC did not immediately respond to a request for comment.</p><p>In a statement, an Amazon spokesperson told Insider that organizations have to meet Amazon's requirements in order to participate in AmazonSmile.</p><p>\"Organizations that engage in, support, encourage, or promote intolerance, hate, terrorism, violence, money laundering, or other illegal activities are not eligible,\" the spokesperson said. \"If at any point an organization violates this agreement, its eligibility will be revoked. Since 2013, Amazon has relied on the U.S. Office of Foreign Assets Control and the Southern Poverty Law Center to help us make these determinations.\"</p><h2>The National Vaccine Information Center is a huge source of anti-vaccination sentiment in the US&#160;</h2><p>The NVIC is \"one of the most prominent organizations that has been against vaccines of any kind,\" K. \"Vish\" Viswanath, a professor of health communication at the Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, told Insider. \"The fact that one of the most prominent, richest, successful companies is actually funding them is shocking.\"&#160;</p><p>The non-profit organization \"campaigns against legislation encouraging or mandating vaccines,\" Popular Information reported.&#160;</p><p>According to the group's website, the NVIC is \"dedicated to preventing vaccine injuries and deaths through public education and advocating for informed consent protections in medical policies and public health laws.\" Barbara Loe Fisher, the NVIC president whom Viswanath said is the nation's most visible spokesperson for \"spreading anti-vaccine sentiment,\" co-founded the group in 1982.&#160;&#160;</p><p>Despite their similar names, the NVIC is unaffiliated with the <a href=\"https://www.hhs.gov/vaccines/about/index.html\">National Vaccine Program Office of the US Department of Health and Human Services</a> (HHS). The \"innocuous\" name of the group is \"very intentional,\" Viswanath said, as it makes the group appear more credible than it is.&#160;</p><p>\"They're very sophisticated in the way they cast seeds of doubt — doubts of vaccines, the effectiveness of vaccines, and the safety of vaccines,\" Viswanath said.&#160;</p><p>That sophistication is evident on the group's website, where a landing page called \"Introduction to Autism Information\" frames the debunked myth that vaccines cause autism as a \"debate.\" There is <a href=\"https://www.cdc.gov/vaccinesafety/concerns/autism.html\">no link</a> between vaccines of any kind of developmental disability.&#160;</p><p>Viswanath said that while Amazon may not have realized the group's true purpose, it's up to the company to take stock of organizations receiving money through AmazonSmile.&#160;\"They have to realize that they are funding an organization that is anti-public health and anti-science,\" he said. \"It's a question of values that they want to espouse as a company.\"</p><h2>It's not Amazon's first brush with criticism over appearing to support anti-vaccination&#160;</h2><p>AmazonSmile also partners with other anti-vaccination groups, Popular Information reported, including the Children's Health Defense and the Informed Consent Action Network, both of which have shared COVID-19 misinformation on Facebook, <a href=\"https://www.mediamatters.org/coronavirus-covid-19/most-notorious-anti-vax-groups-use-facebook-lay-groundwork-against-novel\">according to Media Matters for America (MMFA)</a>, the progressive media watchdog.&#160;</p><p>In March 2019, Democratic Rep. Adam Schiff of California pressured Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos to stop facilitating the spread of vaccine misinformation through anti-vaccination books available on Amazon, The Verge <a href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/1/18246461/amazon-anti-vaccination-vaxx-books-films-vaccines-media-schiff-letter\">reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>\"Every online platform, including Amazon, must act responsibly and ensure that they do not contribute to this growing public-health catastrophe,\" Schiff wrote Bezos in a letter, one year before misinformation related to the COVID-19 pandemic would begin to threaten every social platform.&#160;</p><p>While <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-every-tech-company-social-media-platform-handling-qanon-2020-10\">other tech companies like Facebook</a> have announced efforts to curb the spread of misinformation during the pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-qanon-merchandise-products-shirt-item-facebook-ban-conspiracy-theory-2020-10\">Amazon has been slow to act</a> on removing products related to the QAnon conspiracy theory, declining to comment when previously asked by Insider about the company's stance on the movement.&#160;</p><h2>Vaccine misinformation is increasingly dangerous during the pandemic&#160;</h2><p>Though infectious disease experts have repeatedly warned that the pandemic is not to be taken lightly — 229,000 people have died of the virus in the US alone — myths about the virus and its spread have continued to swarm social media.&#160;</p><p>The NVIC has been a source of COVID-19 misinformation. In a June article, the organization questioned the severity of COVID-19, asking, \"why are the majority of people in educated societies like the U.S. cowering in fear,\" a <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/24/business/media/right-wing-media-stars-mislead-on-covid-19-death-toll.html\">common far-right talking point</a> amid the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>Along with other prominent anti-vaccination groups, the NVIC is using \"Facebook and other major social media platforms to lay the groundwork for widespread coronavirus vaccine rejection,\" <a href=\"https://www.mediamatters.org/coronavirus-covid-19/most-notorious-anti-vax-groups-use-facebook-lay-groundwork-against-novel\">MMFA reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>As Popular Information reported, the group's Facebook page has shared several posts containing false information about the virus, including the false claim that wearing face masks can be dangerous.</p><p>In May, the NVIC also shared a conspiracy theory from QAnon influencer Miss Polly, who is credited with helping start the <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/wayfair-human-trafficking-conspiracy-theory-tied-to-qanon-2020-7\">Wayfair conspiracy theory</a> in July and <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/conspiracy-theory-influencers-sue-youtube-for-removing-content-qanon-2020-10\">has since been banned from YouTube</a>. \"Another BOOM from Amazing Polly,\" the group said in the post's caption.&#160;</p><p>Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones, whose false claims have gotten him banned from mainstream social media platforms, has called the NVIC \"the best-informed group trying to expose the dangers of vaccines,\" <a href=\"https://www.theatlantic.com/health/archive/2019/05/vaccine-safety-program/589354/\">The Atlantic reported</a>.&#160;</p><p>Because the NVIC is against government-mandated vaccines, Viswanath said there's huge overlap between antigovernment or conspiracy theory groups and the NVIC, particularly during the pandemic.&#160;</p><p>The concern, of course, is how \"mainstream\" this type of misinformation has become during the pandemic, Viswanath said, as groups like the NVIC are \"amplifying voices against government mandates\" related to healthcare. \"This is not laying on one corner of the internet,\" he said.&#160;</p><ul class=\"read-more-links\"><li>Read more:</li><li><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-every-tech-company-social-media-platform-handling-qanon-2020-10\">This is how 16 tech companies have reacted to the QAnon conspiracy theory on their platform</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/doctors-say-more-patients-are-denying-medical-advice-misinformation-2020-8\">Doctors say they're dealing with significantly more patients who resist their advice because of misinformation they read online</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/youtube-demonetized-covid-19-disinformation-moderation-automation-bots-strikes-2020-9\">YouTubers' channels and videos are being mistakenly deleted for debunking COVID-19 conspiracy theories</a></li><li><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/what-is-a-vaccine\">What is a vaccine? Why vaccines are important and how long they last</a></li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-reportedly-donated-40000-to-top-vaccine-misinformation-source-2020-10'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:qj6IDK7rITs\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=eGoIgSoK-Ug:Sfz1ThNsx60:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/eGoIgSoK-Ug\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 30 Oct 2020 20:51:03 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5f636c61323fc4001e0d6ceb?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"7aac7067b03470ded6ff725b9854eccd","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn1@2020_2/2020/10/31/07-26-26-076_4bdf5c97ca533db7.webp","destWidth":2666,"destHeight":2000,"sourceBytes":57036,"destBytes":57036,"author":"rgreenspan@businessinsider.com (Rachel E. to give grandparents to thank them for the years of love and attending your off-tune band concerts.</li><li>For more gift ideas, <strong>check out all <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-gift-ideas\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Insider Reviews gift guides here</a>.</strong></li><li><a deals</a>.</li></ul><p>Shopping for grandparents can be daunting. They've likely gotten the basics down pat, and if you ask for ideas you'll likely get a genuine \"nothing\" in response.&#160;</p><p>But these are the people who sat through your band recitals even though they were unbearably boring. They weathered your tantrums and sticky fingers on their furniture, and they probably slipped you candy even when someone else said no. So, what can you do for them?</p><p>Below are 35 gifts that you can feel good about gifting. They're thoughtful, useful, sweet, and bound to be extremely appreciated by grandmas and grandpas.</p><p>Most of these items are available with expedited shipping, and some should arrive within a few days' time, so don't stress too hard about any last-minute shopping — just remember that the sooner you order, the better your chances of a timely arrival.</p><h2>The top 5 best gifts for your grandparents:</h2><ol><li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Beautifully scented candles that come in hand-blown glass containers ($65)</a></li><li><a garden for their kitchen counter ($199.95)</a></li><li><a href=\"https://prf.hn/click/camref:1011l4xn5/adref:biip_120618_gifts-grandparents/destination:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ancestry.com%2Fdna%2F\" book from Artifact Uprising ($59)</a></li><li><a It also meets our editorial criteria in terms of quality and value.*</em></p></section>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tFresh coffee beans from all over the world delivered to their door\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c0994900fefb3094b63a6d4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"atlas coffee club $60, 3 months\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Atlas Coffee Club</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.pntrac.com/t/TUJGRk1NTEJGSEhLR01CRktORkdH?sid=biipg_110618_gifts-for-coffee-lovers&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Fatlascoffeeclub.com%2Fcollections%2Fthe-perfect-gift-for-any-coffee-lover\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Atlas Coffee Subscription or Gift Set, available at Atlas Coffee Club, from $50</a></h3><p>Atlas Coffee sends them fresh beans from across the globe to their door. They'll learn about its flavor profile, tasting notes, suggested brewing methods, a little history lesson in its origins &#8212; and each comes in a bag with festive packaging. If they've been coffee buffs for a while &#8212; or just love having a morning cup &#8212; they'll appreciate both the thought and opportunity to learn something new.&#160;</p>\n\tA Jo Malone diffuser that smells amazing and looks good in a home\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5cbdfba5fa99af7df26ea2e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"4fbc4577 7989 47d7 835a 8b1dcc1f103a\" height=\"2156\" width=\"2874\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Nordstrom</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=1237&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fshop.nordstrom.com%2Fs%2Fjo-malone-lime-basil-mandarin-scent-surround-diffuser%2F3289025%3Forigin%3Dkeywordsearch-personalizedsort%26breadcrumb%3DHome%252FAll%2520Results%26color%3Dnone\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Jo Malone Lime Basil &#38; Mandarin Scent Diffuser, available at Nordstrom, $98</a></h3><p>A diffuser is like the modern take on potpourri, and Jo Malone makes some incredibly good scents. They'll recognize the brand, like the smell, and the clean, minimalist glass container means they won't only bring this out when they know you're coming over.</p>\n\tA bouquet of fresh flowers\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f9c5c206f5b310011724897?format=jpeg\" alt=\"1-800-Flowers\" height=\"809\" width=\"1080\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">1-800-Flowers</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><strong><a href=\"https://1800flowers.7ymy.net/c/196318/363183/5361?subId1=biip_102320_gift-guide-paid-placement&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.1800flowers.com%2Fall-flower-arrangements%3F&#38;subid2=1604082794614a5anaidmv&#38;subId3=xid:fr1604082798196hhi\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">A 1-800-Flowers arrangement, from $29.99</a></strong></h3><p>What's nicer than getting a gorgeous bouquet of sweet-smelling flowers sent to your home? Probably only getting to walk by them every day. If you want to send grandma and/or grandpa a bouquet of something fresh and beautiful to enjoy, order through 1-800-Flowers before 2 p.m. in their time zone, and they can receive it that same day.</p><p><em><strong>*Sponsored by 1-800-Flowers</strong></em></p>\n\tA popular vacuum-insulated stainless steel water bottle\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5df00adefd9db2330c78acab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hydro Flask Wide Mouth\" height=\"931\" width=\"1242\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Hydro Flask</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://goto.walmart.com/c/196318/565706/9383?veh=aff&#38;sourceid=imp_000011112222333344&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.walmart.com%2Fip%2FHydro-Flask-Water-Bottle-32oz-Wide-Mouth-Stainless-Steel-Vacuum-Insulated-with-Flex-Cap-White%2F517109627\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hydro Flask 32-Ounce Wide Mouth Bottle, available at Walmart, $34.59</a></h3><p>This vacuum-insulated stainless steel water bottle works really well. It keeps hot drinks hot for up to six hours, and cold drinks cold up to 24 hours. <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/hydro-flask-coffee-mug-review-2018-11\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">We also love</a> this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Hydro-Flask-Travel-Coffee-Press/dp/B07G3R47K7/ref=as_li_ss_tl?&#38;imprToken=3AL3WFYCKzBRFQQxF8Jong&#38;slotNum=10&#38;dchild=1&#38;keywords=hydroflask+mug&#38;qid=1575491111&#38;sr=8-2&#38;linkCode=ll1&#38;tag=biip_042219_gifts-for-grandparents-20&#38;linkId=796220612f0b3d35619ce0924ea51581&#38;language=en_US\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">$30 mug version</a>.</p>\n\tThe best socks they'll ever wear\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5df012befd9db24fc46de0b4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"bisonsocks1_print_edited Pixlr_800x\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">United by Blue</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"http://www.avantlink.com/click.php?tt=cl&#38;merchant_id=7926b4ed-3067-491f-ba95-7b20f93335e9&#38;website_id=9597bdee-ce2a-4552-aa13-419b5f275c06&#38;url=https%3A%2F%2Funitedbyblue.com%2Fproducts%2Fthe-ultimate-bison-sock\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">The Ultimate Bison Sock, available at United by Blue, $38</a></h3><p>United by Blue makes some of the most comfortable and warmest socks we've ever worn. They're made of merino wool, bison down, and nylon and have reinforced heel and toe areas. We're also big fans of <a href=\"https://www.pjtra.com/t/TUJGRkVJTEJGSEhLR01CRklHSk5I?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbombas.com%2F&#38;sid=1576014077058a42pnco7l\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener\">Bombas socks</a>.&#160;</p>\n\tA DNA test that lets them delve into family history\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5c099ca5f87e1e0969743de1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Ancestry\" height=\"774\" width=\"1032\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Ancestry.com</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<h3><a href=\"https://prf.hn/click/camref:1011l4xn5/adref:biip_120618_gifts-grandparents/destination:https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ancestry.com%2Fdna%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow\">Ancestry DNA Genetic Test, available at Ancestry, $99</a></h3><p>Your grandparents are the origins and default architects of much of your life, and AncestryDNA gives them &#8212; and you &#8212; the chance to explore and appreciate that history. They'll be able to see their heritage and genetic breakdown (aka 50% Irish, 30% Italian, and so on) and can build family trees complete with historical documents and censuses already on the site.
